questDatabase.name: Iron capped Greatwood Wand
questDatabase.description:
Making a gold capped greatwood wand requires 35 vis, but your old wand's limit is 25. So first create an iron or copper capped greatwood wand and then create a gold capped greatwood wand.
Make sure you use NEI 'U' command on the wand caps to find the correct GT:NH recipe for the wand.

questDatabase.name: Don't try to dive with it
questDatabase.description: Combining a scuba helmet with a nano helmet in an assembling machine will give you a nano scuba helmet. You'd better not try to dive with it because you can't. It is a part of the new quantum suit helmet.

questDatabase.name: Plated Leggings - Better not try to wear it
questDatabase.description: Combining stainless steel platings with some nano leggings in the assembler gives you nano plated leggings. Better not try to wear them because you can't. They are part of the new quantum suit leggings.

questDatabase.name: Don't try to walk with it
questDatabase.description: Combining some rubber boots with nano boots in the Assembler gives you Nano Rubber Boots. Better not try to put them on because you can't. They are part of the new quantum suit boots.

questDatabase.name: Iridium Plated
questDatabase.description: Plating all your armor parts with iridium alloy casings gives them a better durability. Before you can wear these quantum armor parts you need to activate them with some quantum crystals.

questDatabase.name: Quantum Armor
questDatabase.description: The quantum armor is a high tier and very durable armor with a lot of features like night vision, fall damage reduction and running very fast.

questDatabase.name: Quantum crystal
questDatabase.description: The quantum crystal is needed to turn quantum armor parts into wearable quantum armor.

questDatabase.name: Lapotron Dust
questDatabase.description: Lapotron crystals require you to mix your energium dust with some lapis dust.

questDatabase.name: Lapotron Crystal
questDatabase.description:
With your new HV mixer you can make lapotron dust. Place it in an autoclave to make some raw lapotron crystals. With an EV assembler and advanced circuits you can make lapotron crystals which store up to 10 million EU.

Hint: Nei shows only ic2 advanced circuits in recipe but all advanced circuits works.

questDatabase.name: Quantum Crystal
questDatabase.description: For your quantum armor you need some quantum crystals. Place a lapotron crystal in your precision laser to get a quantum crystal

questDatabase.name: Mixing at HV Level
questDatabase.description: High Tier dusts need HV Mixer.

questDatabase.name: NASA Workbench aka Dire Crafting Table
questDatabase.description: The Avaritia 9x9 dire crafting table replaces the NASA workbench. It is required to craft all rockets and high tier equipment. First of all you need 81 crafting tables to make a double compressed crafting table, a few HV components, wafers and a crystal matrix. And yes, you do need nether stars. Hint: Check out the nether star recipe which uses null catalyst and salis mundus. Null catalyst can be duplicated by adding magma cream, blaze powder and a tiny pile of nether star dust.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Tier 1
questDatabase.description: After hours of hard work and a few stacks of TNT your first rocket is finally ready. But before you can go to the Moon you need to craft a few more things.

questDatabase.name: Tier 1 Schematic
questDatabase.description: Each rocket needs a construction plan. You can craft the first one using a data circuit and a compressed steel plate in a hv circuit assembler.

questDatabase.name: Tier 1 Heavy Duty Plates
questDatabase.description: Rockets require heavy duty plates for the main hull. Let's craft 36 of these plates out of compressed aluminium plates, compressed bronze plates and compressed steel plates.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Nose Cone
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs a nose cone.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Fins
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs a few rocket fins.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Engine
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs a rocket engine. Better craft two, because the Moon lander needs one also.

questDatabase.name: Moon Lander
questDatabase.description:
The Moon lander is required for a soft landing.
You will need an additional frequency module for hearing things on planets and a second seat for a Moon buggy you may build later.

questDatabase.name: Buggy Seat
questDatabase.description: The buggy seat is part of the Moon lander and the Moon buggy.

questDatabase.name: Frequency Module
questDatabase.description: The frequency Module will help you hear sounds properly while in space (it's also used with the telemetry unit so that your buddies can keep track of you from your base, if you are playing with friends). You need it in your inventory and in the Moon lander.

questDatabase.name: Small Fuel Canister
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs fuel storage canisters. For the tier 1 rocket you need to craft two of them.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Launch Pad
questDatabase.description:
Every rocket needs a launch pad. Build a 3x3 launch pad and place your rocket on top of it.

Make sure you don't have any lightning warp effects or you'll be really sad.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Fuel
questDatabase.description: To pump fuel into your rocket you need a fuel loader. Place it right next to the middle of any side of the launch pad.

questDatabase.name: Oxygen Gear
questDatabase.description: Oxygen gear is used to attach oxygen tanks to the oxygen mask. This is absolutely vital for any astronaut.

questDatabase.name: Oxygen Mask
questDatabase.description: The oxygen mask is part of the system used to breathe on planets without oxygen, the others being oxygen gear and oxygen tanks.

questDatabase.name: Oxygen Tanks
questDatabase.description:
The Light oxygen tank is an oxygen storage tank that can hold up to 900 units of air. It is used to provide a portable source of oxygen while in areas that do not have an oxygen source of their own.

Usage:
Up to two oxygen tanks can be worn at a time. To wear any type of oxygen tank, open your inventory and click on the Galacticraft tab at the top of the menu. Here you will see the available spots for your various types of equipment. Simply place your tank(s) in one of the slots with a grey picture of an oxygen tank. Other types of oxygen tanks are the medium oxygen tank, which holds twice the amount of oxygen as a light tank, and the heavy oxygen tank, which holds three times the amount of a light tank. I recommend making the medium tanks and using the light tanks as spares to return to base.

questDatabase.name: Copper Ore
questDatabase.description:
Can be found between y levels 5 and 60 either as "Copper Ore" or "Chalcopyrite". Most of the time you'll find it together with  "Iron" and "Pyrite".

Hint:
To see where a special ore can be found click the raw ore in NEI and it will show you more details. Works with small ores too.

questDatabase.name: Iron Ore
questDatabase.description:
With iron tools, you are able to mine most of the Overworld ores. I think you already found iron or magnetite. So bring me some ores and make some iron ingots out of them.

Hint:
To see where a special ore can be found click the raw ore in nei and it will show you more details. Works with small ores too.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Fuel
questDatabase.description:
For every flight the rocket needs some fuel. So refine some fuel and fill some fuel canisters. 
You can use Fuel or Rocket Fuel from Ender IO.

questDatabase.name: Oxygen Collector
questDatabase.description: The oxygen collector is a block that gathers oxygen from leaves and farm plants to use in an oxygen bubble distributor, oxygen sealer, oxygen compressor, and other oxygen-reliant machines. If you plan to build a Moon base, which needs a continuous oxygen supply, you will need to build one.

questDatabase.name: Oxygen Compressor
questDatabase.description: The oxygen compressor is used to fill empty or depleted oxygen tanks. Connect an oxygen pipe to the blue ring input side and a power source to the grey square input side. Place an oxygen tank in the bottom right slot and it will take oxygen from the input and place it into the tank.

questDatabase.name: Parachute
questDatabase.description:
A parachute is used to prevent death upon re-entry into the Overworld's atmosphere. The parachute is an essential part of your journey to space. You should never journey into space without it. There will even be a warning if you try to launch without one on you.

Use the assembler to save materials.

questDatabase.name: Advanced Wafers
questDatabase.description: The advanced wafer is used for more advanced machines such as the advanced solar panel or the Avaritia dire crafting table. It is also used in the creation of a space station.

questDatabase.name: Wafers
questDatabase.description: The basic wafer is used for creating basic machines such as the basic solar panel, the fuel loader, the energy storage module and the compressor.

questDatabase.name: Purge your warp
questDatabase.description: The warp you have accumulated over time is starting to become a problem. Making bath salts to clean off the warp is only a temporary solution. To truly get rid of it, you need something more powerful, a pure tear. If you collect a few things for me, I will give you one. Think wisely about using it, since it's a very long journey to unlock it through research.

questDatabase.name: Circuit Boards
questDatabase.description: For every circuit you need a basic circuit board. Craft a coated circuit board and use copper wire to finish it.

questDatabase.name: Resistor
questDatabase.description: Every basic circuit needs two resistors to work

questDatabase.name: Gallium Arsenide
questDatabase.description:
The diode requires gallium arsenide and you may be wondering how to get gallium or arsenic this early in the game.

Sphalerite dust in an electrolyzer is the primary source of gallium at this tier. 
You can also get gallium out of crushed zinc ore by using a thermal centrifuge. You can find the small zinc ores in the Overworld or the in the Nether at Y Level 80 - 210. To get additional crushed ore, use a Tinker's Construct tool with the Luck (Fortune) enchant on it - apply a lot of Lapis. 

You can get arsenic from realgar small ores in the Nether at Y level 5 - 85. Centrifuge the dusts in a centrifuge. Other sources are Tinker's Construct cobalt ore in the nether and cobaltite ore in the Twilight Forest.

You need to level up your obsidian level tool, use a alumite tool, or make an Ironwood Pickaxe to harvest cobalt ore.

Another nice way to get gallium and arsenic is with XP buckets in a crafting grid.

Mix those two dusts in a mixer to get gallium arsenic dust.

In the nether it is easier to use a GT miner near the ceiling to get all the ores you need.

questDatabase.name: ILC and RAM
questDatabase.description:
Advanced circuits need integrated logic circuits and random access memory chips.
You can get those by cutting the ILC and RAM wafers.

questDatabase.name: Advanced Circuits
questDatabase.description: For the next tier we need advanced circuits. To make an advanced circuit, you need good integrated circuits, RAM, an integrated logic circuit, and transistors.

questDatabase.name: Handle tiny piles like a K1ng
questDatabase.description:
Don't you hate having to manually compress all those tiny piles ? Well, let me show you how to automate that. A combination of typefilter, chest buffer (or super buffer in HV) and packager frees you from that annoying task. The chestbuffer can hold up to 9 stacks of tiny piles and the super buffer can hold 256 stacks of tiny dusts, which is more than enough. You can set its mode with a screwdriver on the output side. Set it to 9 to export 9 tiny piles at a time and let the packager compress these into regular dusts.

Super buffers can be lag sources, so be careful to keep them as empty as possible. If you are using a multiblock packager, be sure to change the buffer from Stocking mode to Transfer Size mode.

questDatabase.name: Butane and Propane
questDatabase.description:
You can distill a lot of different gases out of your "refinery gases".
Methane, butane, propane, helium and ethane.

Hint:
Refinery gas is not the best source for Propane and Butane. Better refine those out of naphtha.

questDatabase.name: Tetranitromethane
questDatabase.description: Bio diesel and diesel can be boosted using tetranitromethane. Ethenone and nitric acid are required to make tetranitromethane in a chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: Methane Gas
questDatabase.description: Methane gas with a burn value of 104,000 EU per cell can be burned in the gas turbine.

questDatabase.name: Methanol
questDatabase.description: Methanol with a burn value of 84,000 EU per cell can be used to make biodiesel and other fluids.

questDatabase.name: Ethanol
questDatabase.description: Ethanol with a burn value of 192,000 EU per cell can be used to make biodiesel and other fluids.

questDatabase.name: Bio Diesel Fuel
questDatabase.description:
With ethanol or methanol and seed oil or fish oil you can make bio diesel. Burn value is 256,000 EU per cell. Diesel and bio diesel are needed for cetane-boosted diesel.

You get some glycerol as by-product. Save it so you can make glyceryl trinitrate for your dynamite or for your future epoxid production.

questDatabase.name: O like Oxygen
questDatabase.description: Oxygen can be made in several different ways. Most commonly you'll either electrolyze it out of cassiterite sand, sugar from sugar canes or sugar beets, water, or various other oxygen-rich dusts, or centrifuge it from brown or yellow limonite dust.

questDatabase.name: Ethylene
questDatabase.description:
You can make ethylene many different ways

- Ethanol and sulfuric acid in a Chemical Reactor 
- Ethanol in a Chemical Dehydrator
- Distilling various gases (i.e. wood gas) in a Distillery
- Cracking Naphtha, fuels or refinery gas with hydrogen or steam in the Chemical Reactor will work too. Check NEI or the Game Mechanics Spreadsheet at http://bit.ly/gtnh-datasheets for details

questDatabase.name: Seed Oil
questDatabase.description:
To make some bio diesel you need seed oil or fish oil and mix that with ethanol or methanol. Seeds give seed oil and fish produce fish oil when placed in a fluid extractor.

Pam's peanuts are a good seedoil source.  Another option is Forestry Butternuts. Or you can use IC2 crops to get Rapeseed.

questDatabase.name: Sodium Hydroxide
questDatabase.description:
Make some sodium hydroxide. You can make it out of sodium (or out of salt water once you reach EV).

The by-product hydrogen can be burned in a gas turbine.

questDatabase.name: Ethenone
questDatabase.description:
Hopefully you saved some sulfuric acid during your fuel production. Together with acetic acid you can make ethenone.
Craft an advanced chemical reactor to get access to more advanced recipes.

Save the ethenone for HV, you will need it to make tetranitromethane for cetane boosted diesel.

questDatabase.name: Nitric Acid
questDatabase.description: Nitric acid can be made out of water, oxygen and nitrogen dioxide.

questDatabase.name: Acetic Acid
questDatabase.description: Acetic acid can be made out of oxygen and ethylene. Alternatively, it can be made out of biomass, wood vinegar or vinegar.

questDatabase.name: Nitrogen Dioxide
questDatabase.description: To make nitrogen dioxide you need to combine oxygen gas and nitric oxide in a chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: Ammonia
questDatabase.description: Nitrogen and hydrogen... Ammonia.

questDatabase.name: Nitric Oxide
questDatabase.description: To make nitric oxide you need to combine oxygen and ammonia in a chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: 1,1-Dimetylhydrazine
questDatabase.description: To make 1,1-dimethylhydrazine you need to combine some dimethylamine and chloramine in a chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: Dimethylamine
questDatabase.description: Combining ammonia and methanol in a chemical reactor produces some dimethylamine.

questDatabase.name: Chloramine
questDatabase.description: Combining hypochlorous acid and ammonia in a chemical reactor produces some chloramine.

questDatabase.name: Hypochlorous Acid
questDatabase.description: Hypochlorous acid requires water, chlorine and some mercury.

questDatabase.name: Titanium finally
questDatabase.description:
Rutile, chlorine and carbon dust makes Titaniumtetrachloride. Combining this with Magnesium in an HV EBF will give you hot Titanium ingots. Freeze those and you will get your first titanium.
On the Moon if you are lucky you can find Ilmenite ore which make the processing of Titanium a bit easier.

questDatabase.name: Tungstensteel
questDatabase.description: Tungstensteel is needed for the next tier. Tungsten can be found on Mars or in Moon stone dust. Mix that with some steel dust. Smelt it at 3000K (requires nichrome coils) in an electric blast furnace.

questDatabase.name: Your first bow
questDatabase.description:
Since vanilla bows are only craftable in the assembling machine and mobs do not drop them very often you have to make a Tinkers bow. Wood would be the best material for now.  So craft the bow limbs out of wood and the bow string out of strings. The arrow that has the most durability is bone, so craft the stick out of bone. It is much lighter but less durable than a regular arrow. Use a flint tip to make it repairable with flint.

You can repair your bow the same way as all the other Tinkers tools. Arrows can be regained by repairing them or picking them up from the floor.

questDatabase.name: Bronze javelin
questDatabase.description: The bronze javelin is a bit expensive and has only 7 throws, yet it is a good mid-range weapon. With one bronze ingot you can replenish your stack of javelins.

questDatabase.name: Your first flint throwing knife
questDatabase.description: Is the bone bow too expensive for your taste? Then make a flint throwing knife instead. You need flint and a stick to get 12 knives. The durability and the attack damage are very low but it still helps with killing mobs from a safe distance.

questDatabase.name: Monster trap
questDatabase.description: If you're lucky you spawned in a sand or rainforest biome and find some quicksand. Collect a stack of the stuff, dig a small ditch and fill it with the quicksand to protect your "dirt base" home. Just don't fall in!

questDatabase.name: The transcontinental railroad
questDatabase.description: All the different mining veins that have been found seem to be really far apart. One way to shorten the travel time is to create a railroad from your base to the different mines. Sadly this requires a large amount of both iron and creosote. Let's not forget to place the last symbolic rivet on one of your new train lines.

questDatabase.name: Lapis, Lazurite, Sodalite, Calcite
questDatabase.description:
In order to make your bricked blast furnace you need to find a lapis vine containing calcite.
You can find the vein in the overworld or the Twilight Forest at Y 20-50.

questDatabase.name: Gypsum
questDatabase.description: To make bricks for the blast furnace you need concrete and gypsum. Gypsum can be found in a vein together with basaltic and granitic mineral sand, and fullers earth. Y 50-60 and only in the overworld.

questDatabase.name: Sifting Machine
questDatabase.description:
You need flawless or exquisite diamonds, emeralds, rubies or other gems? Well then it's time for you to make a Sifting Machine.

You can find small Zinc ores (look in NEI) or you can search the Nether for Sphalerite.

You'll need either an Ore Washer or Simple Ore Washer since the Sifter only takes purified ores.

questDatabase.name: Smelt all the things...
questDatabase.description:
Smelting up to nine items at once? With a bit of steel you can make a railcraft Steam Oven. 2x2x2

Hint: All furnace recipes work just fine, but you cannot use it to make charcoal from wood.

questDatabase.name: Molds, molds, molds
questDatabase.description: After you can make steel and have a tinkers smelter you have to make molds. Molds can be used in the alloy smelter and the fluid solidifier. You need them to make vacuum tubes, ingots, gears and more.

questDatabase.name: Maple Syrup
questDatabase.description: You spent hours and hours to find some maple trees? Why not use your forest ranger coins to buy some syrup? Add some spruce saplings and plant some maple trees.

questDatabase.name: Seed Bags
questDatabase.description: Finding some special "pams harvest craft" seeds can be very difficult. With your farmer coins you can buy some seedbags.

questDatabase.name: Jetpack v.0.1 Alpha
questDatabase.description: Do you like flying? Ok then, make a slimy bouncepad and enjoy the good view.

questDatabase.name: Slime Island Journey
questDatabase.description:
Rubber trees are not the only source for raw rubber. Go and find a slimy island high in the sky. Slime balls and slime leaves give raw rubber too.
Make some slime tree farms beside your rubber farm.

questDatabase.name: Bring me my vat of polyethelyne!
questDatabase.description:
Tired of using small cells to process chemicals? Build a Large Chemical Reactor and you can just pipe in and out fluids. Or use the glorious large fluid cells to deliver and remove fluids from the hatches. 

Be careful, if the output hatches are full, the reactor will void any extra products!

Some of the old recipes can now be done simply in the LCR, btw.

The LCR also counts as a cleanroom for any cleanroom recipes.

You will also need:
1 Maintenance Hatch
1 Energy Hatch
1 Input Bus
5 Output Bus
5 Input Hatch
5 Output Hatch

questDatabase.name: Scepter with 75 vis capacity
questDatabase.description: A scepter is crafted from a wand core, a primal charm, three wand caps, a twilight forest monster mob drop, and some screws. Any sort of core or cap may be used, but the caps must match each other. A scepter cannot hold a focus, but holds 150 percent as much vis as a wand with the same core, and gives an additional 5 percent discount for costs, beyond any discounts from its caps or the user's worn equipment.

questDatabase.name: Magic Staff Core
questDatabase.description: A staff requires an extra step for crafting: Two (matching) wand cores must be combined with a primal charm, and crystal clusters to produce a staff core. (While the recipes are all similar, each type of staff core requires a separate research topic to be learned.)

questDatabase.name: Primal Charm
questDatabase.description:
With your new 50 vis wand you are able to make a Scepter which holds up to 75 vis.
First you need some primal charms which cost 50 vis to craft.

questDatabase.name: Witch
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. What's cooking?

questDatabase.name: Pigmen
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Do you want some bacon?

questDatabase.name: Blaze
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Let me warm you up a bit.

questDatabase.name: Magma Cube
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely, and bouncy.

questDatabase.name: Enderman
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Don't look me in the eyes!

questDatabase.name: Cave Spider
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Let me sing itsy-bitsy spider for you.

questDatabase.name: Ghast
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. At least you're not a big cry-baby?

questDatabase.name: A Wizard's Staff has a Knob on the End
questDatabase.description: Join the core with two wand caps, a twilight forest mob drop, and screws just as for making a wand. A staff cannot be used for crafting, but holds 250 percent as much vis as a corresponding wand. It can even serve as a backup weapon for melee. While it cannot receive weapon enchantments, its damage is decent, and it does not take damage with use (no durability bar).

questDatabase.name: Silverfish
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Let me be as annoying as possible.

questDatabase.name: Magma Cube
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Wanna bounce?

questDatabase.name: Better Tank... ULV Tank
questDatabase.description: Next step is to store 32 buckets in a tank. The ULV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, iron plates, tin plates, a clay pipe, and a water bucket.

questDatabase.name: Better Tank... LV Tank
questDatabase.description: Next step is to store 64 buckets in a tank. The LV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, iron plates, bronze plates, a huge clay pipe, and an LV pump.

questDatabase.name: Better Tank... MV Tank
questDatabase.description: Next step is to store 128 buckets in a tank. The MV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, darksteel plates, bronze plates, a bronze pipe and an LV pump.

questDatabase.name: You're gonna hate this #2 in MV too
questDatabase.description:
The second item you'll need a lot of in MV tier. When you want to get fluid out of tanks you'll need one. 

Hint: Goes pretty well with fluid pipes or GT machines, adjust with a screwdriver. It can also be upgraded further into a fluid regulator which allows precise control of fluid transfer speed.

questDatabase.name: Better Tank... HV Tank
questDatabase.description: Next step is to store 256 buckets in a tank. The HV Tank from Gt++ needs aluminium plates, darksteel plates, vacuum tubes, a steel pipe, and an MV pump.

questDatabase.name: You're gonna hate this #1 in MV too
questDatabase.description:
The first item you'll need a lot of in MV too. If you want to pull items out of chests or barrels you'll need one. 

Hint: Goes pretty well with item pipes or GT machines, adjust with a screwdriver.

questDatabase.name: You're gonna hate this #3 in MV too
questDatabase.description: An electric piston for your MV machines. The third item you are going to craft a lot of in the future.

questDatabase.name: You're gonna hate this #4 in MV too
questDatabase.description:
The fourth item you'll need a lot of in MV, which is also a pain to craft. Arguably the most painful item ever. 

Hint: Works like a conveyor but can work with selected item slots. Adjust with a screwdriver.

questDatabase.name: Simple Ore Washer
questDatabase.description: Too lazy to make an ore washer, yet bored with your non-automatable cauldron? Then the simple washer is the machine for you! It works reasonably fast and uses only 8eu max - make sure you don't provide too much voltage! Ok, so you do not get any byproducts, but who cares!

questDatabase.name: Paying the highest price
questDatabase.description: A tier 2 blood altar needs 8 runes placed around the altar. Your new altar can hold more blood.

questDatabase.name: Don't look it in the eyes!
questDatabase.description: Bad things may happen if this creature is allowed to stay alive. The ores in its cave are valuable anyway.

questDatabase.name: I don't even...
questDatabase.description: Ok so there is this maze. And there are... minotaurs. But what in the world is a minoshroom?

questDatabase.name: A big ugly snake
questDatabase.description: Required for your first wand and in general, an ugly creature.

questDatabase.name: Adventure time!
questDatabase.description: Stop him before he makes his wish at Prismos'!

questDatabase.name: Who you're gonna call?
questDatabase.description: Phantom Busters! Or wait... Ah whatever. They drop good armor by the way.

questDatabase.name: The big fluffy crybaby
questDatabase.description: It flies, it makes funny sounds, and .. IT'S SO FLUFFY! Well, kill it.

questDatabase.name: Let her go
questDatabase.description: It seems the cold doesn't bother her. Committed crimes: None. But... you know... you have to progress somehow...

questDatabase.name: Yeti. Alpha, Yeti.
questDatabase.description: Wanted: Alpha Yeti. Death. Committed crimes: Violently throwing ice at people, for no reason.

questDatabase.name: Secret: A nice....
questDatabase.description: Hey, you! I want that lamp. I have something for you in return. You don't need it anyways, do you?

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Creeper)
questDatabase.description: Who hasn't experienced this... You think nothing evil, mine a few diamonds, and suddenly, you wake up in your bed, all your items gone. Time to strike back!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Pigman)
questDatabase.description: "Zombie Pigman"? What the hell is going on with you zombies! Maybe you should encase your animals better at night...

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Spiders)
questDatabase.description: Eeeek! Wall climbing monsters, gross! Slay them. Quickly! Watch out for the witch spiders, they can give as good as they get.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Skeleton)
questDatabase.description:
Arrows are nice, if you shoot them. If one hits you, well, bad things happen. 

Hint: Arrows are an excellent source of telum.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Blaze)
questDatabase.description: You should be careful with this task. Fire protection is highly recommended.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Zombie)
questDatabase.description: Nobody knows who they are, or where they came from. They're just annoying at night, and too stupid to make a crafting table.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Enderman)
questDatabase.description: Uh, fancy teleport pearls. You need them. All of them. Now!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Wither)
questDatabase.description:
After collecting a couple of those wither skeleton heads, you feel like you could use some more action. So why not kill a wither? You'll need a ton of nether stars anyway...

Kill it twice for something nice.

questDatabase.name: Secret: The trade for life
questDatabase.description: You have been busy my friend. I have something for you. Give me your hearts, and I will magically enhance them so you can actually use them.

questDatabase.name: Skeleton: Evolved
questDatabase.description: In order to advance to a higher tier and reach Mars, Deimos and Phobos, you need to make yourself a better rocket. There are rumors that an Evolved Skeleton hiding out on the Moon has schematics of such a device.

questDatabase.name: Creeper: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Not that regular creepers are nasty enough, no. There is an evolved creeper boss! He is your key (Well he HAS a key...) to reach the next tier of planets (Asteroid Belt, Ceres, Io, Europa, Ganymede, Callisto).

questDatabase.name: Blaze: Evolved
questDatabase.description: In order to proceed to Tier 4 Planets, the blaze boss needs to be killed. Find him in one of the dungeons on Ceres.

questDatabase.name: Ghast: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Fluffy, fluffier, ghasts! And also big crybabies. This one hides in a dungeon on IO, and holds the key for Tier 5 planets.

questDatabase.name: Crystal Boss: Ayyy.. Wait, what?
questDatabase.description: Seriously, a crystal boss? Anyway, it's your key to Tier 6 planets, and he lurks around on Enceladus.

questDatabase.name: Slime: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Totally looks like a thaumic slime to me. Don't you think so? Find this dude on Proteus.

questDatabase.name: Wolf:Evolved
questDatabase.description: The final frontier... A... wolf that is not even an Iron Maiden fan?... What did you expect, a super boss? Heh. No. Budget was too tight...

questDatabase.name: Technology: Evolved
questDatabase.description: You beat the game, literally. There is nothing left to do, you might want to try real life... But one thing might be interesting for you. You know, just for the phuns. Select one of the totally OP items here.

Lore: This! Is OP

questDatabase.name: Blood Altar Tier 3
questDatabase.description: To make your altar more powerful you need to upgrade it. You need to build pillars two block high out of blood-soaked thaumium block and on top one block of glowstone blocks on each pillar.

questDatabase.name: Blood Altar Tier 4
questDatabase.description: If you want to make tier 4 slates you need a Tier 4 altar. This can be made like the tier 3 altar with pillars out of void-blood-soaked stones four blocks high and a blood brick on top of the pillars.

questDatabase.name: Blood Altar Tier 5
questDatabase.description: If you want to make tier 5 slates you need a Tier 5 altar. This can be made with 4 beacons. Beacons have thaumcraft recipes and can be found in the thaumcraft book on the GTNH page.

questDatabase.name: Blood Altar Tier 6
questDatabase.description: The highest tier of the blood altar is tier 6. You need pillars of blood-soaked ichorium 7 blocks high and on top the crystal cluster blocks made out of demon soul shards.

questDatabase.name: Auto Mining
questDatabase.description:
A miner in LV age? Wow! This nifty machine will find ores for you. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This machine needs 8 EU/t to work. The miner searches for ores in a 17x17 block work area. Now comes with 2 fortune bonus! Great for gathering additional small ores...

Don't forget to cover it up! These are GT machines, so remember to protect them (and their power sources!) from rain on any side. And set a waypoint with Journeymaps so you don't forget where you placed it!

questDatabase.name: Auto Mining MV
questDatabase.description:
The MV miner will find ores for you faster than the LV miner. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This miner need 32 eu to work. The Miner searches ores in a 33x33 block area and works two times faster than the LV variant. Comes with 4 fortune bonus, great for gathering small ores in the Nether.
These are GT machines, so remember to protect them (and their power sources!) from rain on any side. And set a waypoint with Journeymaps so you don't forget where you placed it!

questDatabase.name: Auto Mining HV
questDatabase.description: The HV miner will find ores for you faster than the MV miner. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This miner needs 128 eu to work. The Miner searches ores in a 49x49 block area (three chunks wide, perfect for a chunkloader) and works two times faster than the MV variant. It also has a 6 fortune bonus, making it even better for small ores.  Recommend taking some with you to the Moon to gather meteoric iron.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun
questDatabase.description:
Now its time to invest in some renewable energy. Let's start with solar panels. The basic one only gives 1 EU/t. Most GT machines can use them as covers. Be sure to put a glass layer above them in case it rains while you swap panels. You will still want to keep rain off the sides of the machine hull too.

The Aluminium Iron plate needs an MV Forming Press.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 8V
questDatabase.description: The next solar panel you can make is the ULV one. It generates 8 EU/t. Most gt machines can use them as covers.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 1x1
questDatabase.description: Put those single eu panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an MV assembler to combine the panel with a ULV hull.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun at LV Level
questDatabase.description: The next solar panel you can make is the LV one. It generates 32 EU/t max. Most gt machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce a sunnarium item by using 10 million eu power.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 1x1 LV
questDatabase.description: Put those 32 EU panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an MV assembler to combine the panel with an LV hull, a battery, and a robot arm. Now this panel will clean itself!

questDatabase.name: Automated Sticky Resin Farmer
questDatabase.description: If you are tired of crafting tons of tree taps, how about a machine that uses power but never breaks? Let's craft an electric tree tap!

questDatabase.name: Automated Farmer
questDatabase.description: Your hoe must be getting worn out by now. Why not craft an electric one which never breaks?

questDatabase.name: Cleanroom
questDatabase.description:
If you want to make more advanced circuits you'll need a cleanroom. The cleanroom is a multiblock between 3x4x3 and 15x15x15 (WxHxD) blocks. Besides plascrete blocks for all edges you'll need a controller in the top center, filter machine casings for the rest of the top except edges, an energy and maintenance hatch , a reinforced door and three machine hulls. For now you can use MV tier.

Let's build a 5x5x5 room. Expanding it vertically is easy to do, or you can make it wider and longer, as long as both X and Z match and are odd. Up to 5% of the plascrete blocks can be replaced with Reinforced Glass to see into the cleanroom and check on machines.

You can pass materials through the walls using Machine Hulls.  You can pass 1A of power using Machine Hulls as well, or you can use Diodes to pass multiple amps through walls.

Just be really careful when upgrading you machines. Be sure to remove the machine hulls and diodes and replace them with the new power tier, or else you will be very sad.

If the Cleanroom has maintenance issues, it will have a chance to void recipes needing a cleanroom. Monitor your cleanroom with a Hand Scanner, Industrial Information Panel, or using a Needs Maintenance Cover and a Redstone Powered Light or Howler Alarm.

questDatabase.name: A very useful Scanner
questDatabase.description:
The portable scanner is a tool capable of showing advanced information about almost every block in the game. 
In order to function, the tool needs to be charged first. It can hold up to 400k EU and accept 128 EU/t or less. This is MV tier.

It can scan crops, which shows more information than the cropnalyzer does. The crop, which was scanned in the world, will drop a scanned seed bag.
It can scan machines from GregTech, giving information about current progress, the stored energy, efficiency, problems and CPU-load - be sure to check the full chat window for additional details.
For any block in the game it scans, it gives information about its ID, Metadata, position in the world and hardness value.
It also gives information about pollution level in the chunk the scanned block belongs to.
In addition it shows when the cleanroom has reached its 100 percent efficieny level.

questDatabase.name: It's a dirty job, and you're going to do it
questDatabase.description:
The Plunger is used to clear liquids from pipes. It can also be used on a machine to remove up to 1000mb of fluid from its internal buffer. You don't have to wrench your machine and replace it. It can be crafted from a rod of the desired material and rubber sheets. 

Hint: Plunger deals 2.75 - 7.75 damage depending on the materials used.

questDatabase.name: Performing chemical experiments at HV Level
questDatabase.description: High tier chemical recipes like ammonia need an HV chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: Super Tank I
questDatabase.description: Next step is to store 4000 buckets in a tank. The super tank I needs a hermetic casing made with aluminium plates and PTFE pipe. The tank need 4 circuits, a pulsating iron plate and an MV pump. Now you can store the same amount of fluids a steel 5x5 Railcraft tank contains in a single block.

questDatabase.name: Chad - A better way to make Paper
questDatabase.description: Making paper out of wood pulp and water can be tedious and difficult. Why not macerate some sugar cane down to chads and press it with two stone plates to paper? Later on you can use the chemical bath for a even better ratio.

questDatabase.name: Bamboo fence
questDatabase.description:
Maybe you are lucky and start off in a bamboo forest.
Bamboo is a very useful tree since it grows really fast and when you place bamboo sticks they will grow and protect your base behind a 3 block tall wall.
Alternatively, you can also use Berry Bushes.

questDatabase.name: Punji Sticks
questDatabase.description: A early game protection moat can be made out of punji sticks. It hurts all mobs/players and additionally gives a slowness II potion effect. Make a trench around your base and put the punji sticks inside.

questDatabase.name: Better than iron
questDatabase.description:
Wrought Iron will become more important very soon when you have a bit of steel and are able to build high pressure steam machines. The material is much harder than iron, and you can make better tools with it too.
To make wrought iron, you need a tinkers smelter to melt some iron ingots down and cast nuggets; put these in a furnace to get wrought iron nuggets. With the compressor, you can compress the nuggets into ingots.

Hint:
Crushed or purified iron ore (not an impure version, look for Chalcopyrite veins) can be smelted to iron nuggets directly. Or you can use an alloy smelter to turn iron ingots into nuggets faster than a smeltery.

Later on, you can use an arc furnace to make wrought iron ingots directly.

questDatabase.name: Garden Bags
questDatabase.description: Finding some special "Pam's HarvestCraft" gardens can be very difficult. With your farmer coins you can buy some garden bags.

questDatabase.name: XP berries
questDatabase.description: And a few xp berries for cash.

questDatabase.name: Fluid Solidifier
questDatabase.description: Use molds to make plates, sticks, bolts and many more item parts in the fluid solidifier.

questDatabase.name: Base too big? I've got a fix for you!
questDatabase.description: Keeping a base spread apart for pollution or explosion prevention can really wear you out. Try harvesting some Marble and centrifuging it into Calcite, and mix up some concrete in your Mixer. Next output it into a Fluid Solidifier with a block mold to make concrete blocks. You'll move faster on top of these blocks. They can even be turned into bricks to prevent unwanted spawns! Hint: 10 buckets of wet mix converts to exactly 160 blocks. These blocks can also be Chiseled into different varieties.

questDatabase.name: Stainless Steel Pipes
questDatabase.description: Stainless steel pipes are much better than steel pipes. Like all high tier pipes (Titanium, Tungstensteel etc) you need a better wrench to deconstruct the pipes.

questDatabase.name: The "Water Problems" are solved
questDatabase.description: Entering the HV age you found a way of making a water reservoir which solves the finite water problem. Craft it with some fused quartz glass, HV pumps, and cauldrons.

questDatabase.name: Piston
questDatabase.description: Want some pistons? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Bronze Fluid Pipes
questDatabase.description: Want some bronze fluid pipes? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Magnetic Iron
questDatabase.description: Want some magnetic iron for motors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Tin Rotor
questDatabase.description: Want some tin rotors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Iron Rods
questDatabase.description: Want some iron rods? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Brass Rod
questDatabase.description: Want some brass rods? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Certus Quartz
questDatabase.description: Want some certus quartz? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Vroooooom...
questDatabase.description:
Tired of standing around to collect all the drops and XP from your diamond spikes?

Make yourself a vacuum hopper to suck up all the drops and XP.  Feed the XP into a tank to store it.

questDatabase.name: Basic Circuit Board
questDatabase.description: Want some basic circuit boards? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Good Circuit Board
questDatabase.description: Want some good circuit boards? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Vacuum Tubes
questDatabase.description: Want some vacuum tubes? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Resistors
questDatabase.description: Want some resistors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Diodes
questDatabase.description: Want some diodes? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Wafers
questDatabase.description: Want some wafers? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Transistors
questDatabase.description: Want some transistors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Ram Wafer
questDatabase.description: Want some ram wafers? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Integrated Logic Circuit Wafer
questDatabase.description: Want some integrated logic circuit wafers? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Oil
questDatabase.description: Want some oil? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Creosote Oil
questDatabase.description: Want some creosote oil? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Naphtha
questDatabase.description: Want some naphtha? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Methane
questDatabase.description: Want some methane? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Ethanol
questDatabase.description: Want some ethanol? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Oxygen
questDatabase.description: Want some oxygen? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Nitrogen
questDatabase.description: Want some nitrogen? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Hydrogen
questDatabase.description: Want some hydrogen? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Glue
questDatabase.description: Want some glue? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Lubricant
questDatabase.description: Want some lubricant? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Sulfuric Acid
questDatabase.description: What some sulfuric acid? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Engineering processor
questDatabase.description: Want some engineering processors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Silverwood Sapling
questDatabase.description: Silverwood saplings are always rare to find. Want some? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Ghast)
questDatabase.description:
They shoot you with explosive fireballs but they are weak when you hit them or knock the fireballs back with a weapon. Better upgrade your armor with fire and blast protection.

Sorry about the giant ghast Amancila, it can't be changed. 

You'll need to kill 10.

questDatabase.name: Is this the End? No the END Dimension
questDatabase.description:
Your investigation into the pearls has shown you that the source of the disturbance seems to be coming out of the shimmering portals inside strongholds. You feel strangely drawn into its mysterious depths.

Hint: throwing Ender Eyes in the air in the Overworld will guide you to the nearest stronghold . From time to time Ender Eyes are destroyed in this process, so make extras.

questDatabase.name: Upgraded RF Batteries
questDatabase.description: Capacitor Banks are upgraded RF batteries which can store the RF power you generate. You can put many blocks together to enlarge your total battery capacity.

questDatabase.name: Bigger, Better, Chargier?
questDatabase.description: The Vibrant Capacitor Bank is the largest RF Battery for now. It can store 25 million RF in a single block. Putting many capacitor banks together will enlarge your total battery capacity.

questDatabase.name: Vibrant alloy
questDatabase.description: Vibrant alloy is a high tier EnderIO alloy made out of ender eye, energetic alloy and chrome dust. 3600k heating coils and a vacuum freezer are needed to make ingots.

questDatabase.name: Energetic Alloy
questDatabase.description: Energetic alloy is a new alloy from EnderIO made out of gold, conductive iron and black steel dust. Double-layer capacitors need it and it can be made in the  electric blast furnace with tier 2 coils (2700K).

questDatabase.name: Dark Steel Armor basic upgrades
questDatabase.description: In order to upgrade one armor item with basic upgrades, you need a vibrant crystal and 10 xp levels.

questDatabase.name: Go find some tropical bees
questDatabase.description:
Next you will need to find some tropical bees. The hives can be found in Jungle biomes. Be careful as these bees are very aggressive and can poison you. Collect the silky combs and extract some silk wisp from those in order to make some Apiarist's clothes.
Looking for pristine Bees.

questDatabase.name: Silky combs and Propolis
questDatabase.description:
Collect silky combs and extract some silk wisp out of it in order to make some Apiarist's clothes.
This can take quite a bit of time.
Use a GregTech or Forestry Centrifuge to get Silky Propolis.

questDatabase.name: The Centrifuge
questDatabase.description: The Forestry Centrifuge is able to centrifuge up to 9 items out of bee combs. It uses RF energy.

questDatabase.name: Woven silk
questDatabase.description:
Centrifuge your silky propolis to get some silk wisp at a chance of 60 percent. Put 9 silk wisp in the Forestry carpenter or Gregtech assembler to get woven silk. 
This fine fabric can be used for crafting Apiarist's Clothes or to upgrade your Forestry Backpacks to 45 slots.

questDatabase.name: Apiarist's Cloth
questDatabase.description: If you have collected 24 woven silk you can make a complete Apiarist's suit to be protected from bee stings and other bad bee effects. You can also use the suit parts to upgrade your EnderIO Dark Steel Armor.

questDatabase.name: Dark Steel Armor advanced upgrades
questDatabase.description:
Your Dark Steel armor can be upgraded in various ways by combining it with various other items. You will need an anvil and a lot of XP.

Make sure when making the potions to only do three at a time, so the NBT data matches.

questDatabase.name: Dark Steel Tool and Weapon basic upgrades
questDatabase.description: In order to upgrade a weapon or tool, you need a vibrant crystal and 10 xp levels.

questDatabase.name: Dark Steel Tool and Weapon advanced upgrades
questDatabase.description: Your weapons and tools can be upgraded even more by adding capacitors and various other items.

questDatabase.name: RF Solar Panel
questDatabase.description: It is possible to power RF machines with a solar panel. It outputs 10 RF/t. Perfect for low use RF machines.

questDatabase.name: RF Solar Panel Tier 2
questDatabase.description: The upgraded RF solar panel is much better. It outputs 40 RF/t.

questDatabase.name: Enchanted Earth
questDatabase.description: Enchanted Earth makes saplings and seeds planted on it grow faster. When stacked on top of each other it has a chance to add ticks to the block above accumulating all the way to the top. This will randomly speed up growth a bit.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun at MV Level
questDatabase.description: The next solar panel you can make is the MV one. It gives 128 EU/t max. Most GT machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce sunnarium out of 9 smaller sunnarium pieces.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 1x1 MV
questDatabase.description: Put those 128 EU panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an HV assembler to combine the panel with an MV hull, a battery, and a robot arm. This panel doesn't need to be cleaned manually.

questDatabase.name: Indium
questDatabase.description:
At EV Level you are able to make Indium for HV Solar Panels. Indium cannot be found in Ore form. It can only be made with an EV chemical reactor.
First you need to make indium out of purified galena and sphalerite ore. Mix in some aluminium to get indium.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun at HV Level
questDatabase.description: The next solar panel you can make is the HV one. It generates 512 EU/t max. Most GregTech machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce enriched sunnarium by mixing irradiated uranium and sunnarium. The Avaritia 9x9 dire crafting table is required to make this panel.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 1x1 HV
questDatabase.description: Put those 512 EU panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an EV assembler to combine the panel with an HV hull, a battery, and a robot arm. This panel doesn't need to be cleaned manually.

questDatabase.name: Books
questDatabase.description:
Books can be found easily enough in villages or in the roguelike dungeons surface brick house.
I'm sure they have a recipe too.

Now glue on the other hand...or should I say horse? Try and get a horse inside a smeltery and feed it hay to keep it alive.

Or you can wait until after you go to the Nether and get some sulfur. Either way.

questDatabase.name: Fish trapping 2.0
questDatabase.description:
Fishing can be very boring. Why not automate it with a fish trap?
This is your fish trap 2.0

questDatabase.name: Fresh Water and Milk
questDatabase.description:
Many cooking recipes need milk and water. Crafting it in the crafting table can be very tedious.
It is much easier using a Forestry worktable. Drag-click all your buckets into the worktable, and craft them all at once.

questDatabase.name: Find Bauxite
questDatabase.description: The main goal when you reach the Moon is to find some bauxite ore to make titanium for the EV machine tier. Some meteoric iron is required for your tier 2 rocket for reaching Mars so be sure to collect a stack from fallen meteors and small ores beneath the surface.

questDatabase.name: Rutile
questDatabase.description:
Rutile can be thermal centrifuged out of bauxite and ilmenite dust. 
Electrolyzing bauxite can extract even more rutile and putting ilmenite in the electric blast furnace can give some rutile too.

questDatabase.name: SMD Circuit components
questDatabase.description:
Surface-mount devices are more advanced circuits parts. They are needed for high tier circuits and are cheaper to craft than basic capacitors, transitors, diodes and resistors. You need an Advanced Assembler and some molten polyethylene.

Be sure to check how much gallium you have available. It might not be worth it to use SMD diodes and resistors until you have a steady supply with an HV macerator, bees, or bauxite ore. Also look into IC2 crops to 4x your zinc, sphalerite, and bauxite.

The easiest way to get Platinum is with Nickel ore and a chemical bath.

questDatabase.name: Workstation Extreme Circuit
questDatabase.description:
The next tier of circuits are the extreme circuits. Workstation Circuits are the easiest one and are needed in EV Tier. Let's craft some.

In addition, you will need 16 Diodes, SMD or non-SMD.

questDatabase.name: Empty Plastic Board
questDatabase.description: Plastic circuit boards require plastic Plate with Sulfuric Acid to make an Empty Board. By adding copper foil and Iron(III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate you can craft a plastic circuit board.

questDatabase.name: Integrated Processor
questDatabase.description:
There are three variants of good circuits. The good electronic circuit, the good integrated circuit and the integrated processor which needs an MV circuit assembling machine. The integrated processor requires a CPU, capacitors, transistors and resistors.
A cleanroom is needed.

You will need in addtion 4 Resistors, 4 Capacitors and 4 Transistors. You can use SMD or non SMD versions.

questDatabase.name: Processor Assembly
questDatabase.description:
Another variant of the advanced circuit from IC2 is the processor assembly.
Two Integrated Processors are needed in the MV circuit assembler recipe.
The recipe is a cleanroom recipe.

In addition you will need 8 Capacitors, SMD or non-SMD is fine.

questDatabase.name: Central Processing Unit
questDatabase.description:
Integrated Processors need central processing units. You can get these by cutting a ram wafer.
A cleanroom is needed.

questDatabase.name: Small Coil
questDatabase.description: Processing assembly needs some small coils.

questDatabase.name: Iron (III) Chloride
questDatabase.description:
Iron(III) Chloride can be made by first making hydrochloric acid out of hydrogen and chlorine. Then combine this with some iron dust to make Iron(III) Chloride.
You can etch your board with it.

questDatabase.name: Sodium Persulfate
questDatabase.description:
Sodium Persulfate can be made in the electrolyzer out of sodium bisulfate dust.
Sodium bisulfate is made out of sulfuric acid and salt in the chemical reactor.
You can etch your board with it.
Save the hydrochloric acid for your future epoxid production.

questDatabase.name: Magnetic Steel
questDatabase.description: Want some magnetic steel for motors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Alu Rods
questDatabase.description: Want some alu rods? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Bronze Rotor
questDatabase.description: Want some bronze rotors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Steel Fluid Pipes
questDatabase.description: Want some steel fluid pipes? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Electrum Rods
questDatabase.description: Want some electrum rods? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Flawless Emerald
questDatabase.description: Want some flawless emeralds? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Ender Pearl
questDatabase.description: Want some ender pearls? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Magnetic Neodymium
questDatabase.description: Want some magnetic neodymium for motors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Stainless Steel Rods
questDatabase.description: Want some stainless steel rods? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Steel rotor
questDatabase.description: Want some steel rotors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Stainless Steel Fluid Pipes
questDatabase.description: Want some stainless steel fluid pipes? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Chrome Rods
questDatabase.description: Want some chrome rods? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Ender Eyes
questDatabase.description: Want some ender eyes? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Be sure to get your armpits
questDatabase.description: Want to use all that delicious XP to raise your levels? Move the tank with XP above you and attach this convenient shower head to take the XP from the tank.

questDatabase.name: Plastic Circuit Board
questDatabase.description: Want some plastic circuit boards? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Central Procesing Unit Wafer
questDatabase.description: Want some central processing unit wafers? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Resistors SMD
questDatabase.description: Want some SMD resistors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Diodes SMD
questDatabase.description: Want some SMD diodes? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Transistors SMD
questDatabase.description: Want some SMD transistors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Capacitor SMD
questDatabase.description: Want some SMD capacitors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Logic processor
questDatabase.description: Want some logic processors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Chlorine
questDatabase.description: Want some chlorine? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Iron (III) Chloride
questDatabase.description: Want some iron 3 chloride? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Sodium Persulfate
questDatabase.description: Want some sodium persulfate? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Pyrochlore Ore
questDatabase.description: Can't find Pyrochlore ore because of an old worldgen? Buy some Ores.

questDatabase.name: Forest Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Forest Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Deep Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Attuned Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Ender Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Ender Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Bees House
questDatabase.description: Want some bee houses? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Apiary
questDatabase.description: Want some Apiaries? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Impregnated Frames
questDatabase.description: Want some impregnated frames? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Infernal Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Infernal Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Oblivion Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Oblivion Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Did you want to know your warp level?
questDatabase.description:
After a few forbidden researches your warp level has increased a bit. Do you want to know how much warp you have?
Craft some litmus paper to print out the warp level.

questDatabase.name: Meadow Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Meadows Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Modest Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Modest Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Tropical Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Forest Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Wintry Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Wintry Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Marshy Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Marshy Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Water Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Water Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Rocky Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Rocky Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Nether Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Embittered Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Curious Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Mystical Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Unusual Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Unusual Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Resonating Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Sorcerous Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Space Station
questDatabase.description:
Here's an idea for your space station.
You can add up to four spin thrusters to your station to rotate it.

Days on space stations last longer than on the overworld, so you can generate more solar power.

questDatabase.name: Are you prepared?
questDatabase.description:
Are you prepared for the Moon?
A few things will help you to live longer and prevent you from dying on the Moon.
If you die on the moon you will be returned to earth without your stuff. A Soulbind enchantment will keep an item with you when you die.
Graves are placed at the location where you died.

questDatabase.name: Oak, Spruce, Birch, Jungle Sapling
questDatabase.description: You spawned in a desert and need Oak or Birch saplings? No problem! For five Forestry Coins you can select which one you want to buy.

questDatabase.name: Magic Feather
questDatabase.description:
Let's craft some magical Map focuses to create a magical map which will help you find Twilight Monster Bosses.
Go find some Raven feathers. You can get them by killing Ravens sitting on Obsidian Blocks in Twilight. Then you need some Torchberries and some Glowstone dust.

questDatabase.name: Magic Map
questDatabase.description: For the Magic map you need the magic map focus and a stack of paper. Please only use the map in the Twilight Forest. You can only get one map every 24 hours so be careful with it. Using the map in the Overworld or another dimension will lag the server.

questDatabase.name: Moon arrival
questDatabase.description:
I have a small present for you: a Talisman of Remedium which is very useful to persevere during the dark nights with all these monsters.
First you have to prove you can survive on the moon by yourself. After mining some moon turf, dirt, and rock, you can have it.

Make sure you check back in the HV questline for necessary ores you should gather while here.

questDatabase.name: Naga
questDatabase.description: Summon a Naga in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Lich
questDatabase.description: Summon a Lich in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Minoshroom
questDatabase.description: Summon a Minoshroom in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Hydra
questDatabase.description: Summon a Hydra in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Knight Phantom
questDatabase.description: Summon a Knight Phantom in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Ur Ghast
questDatabase.description: Summon an Ur-Ghast in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Yeti
questDatabase.description: Summon a Yeti in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Snow Queen
questDatabase.description: Summon a Snow Queen in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: MV Bending
questDatabase.description: This Plate Bending Machine allows you to directly make double, triple or more compressed plates, which might be useful for your first rocket in HV Tier.

questDatabase.name: MV Battery Buffers
questDatabase.description:
MV machines can internally hold 1 battery. But sometimes you need to store more power than that, or you want a whole powerline to share batteries. You can use a battery buffer to store large amounts of batteries. They come in different sizes like 1x, 4x, 9x and 16x.
Build a 4x buffer.

questDatabase.name: MV Lithium Battery
questDatabase.description: Better machines need some better batteries. Lithium is the best material to use when making batteries.

questDatabase.name: Lubricant
questDatabase.description:
Using lubricant instead of water or distilled water in your cutting machines will increase the output or speed of the machines.
You can make lubricant out of oil, seed oil, fish oil or creosote in a distillery. If you are able to craft a brewery you can use talc and soapstone to get much more lubricant each cycle.

Lube cells are required to make low tier energy hatches, so stockpile a few cells and use the rest to make your cutting machine faster.

questDatabase.name: More Compact Storage
questDatabase.description: Now that you are starting to find more and more iron you feel your wood chests are too small to hold all the stuff you found and collected. Now it's time to upgrade your chests to iron chests. You can just build a new chest or upgrade the wood chest with a wood to iron chest upgrade item.

questDatabase.name: Juice
questDatabase.description: Most of your berries can be extracted to juice. This is a chance to get more food variants and the nutritional value is higher than eating the fruit directly.

questDatabase.name: Potato Cakes
questDatabase.description: Potatoes, onions, butter and a skillet make very tasty potato cakes.

questDatabase.name: Fried Eggs
questDatabase.description: So easy, skillet and an egg.... fried egg.

questDatabase.name: Hearty Breakfast
questDatabase.description:
Let's now combine all the things together and make a healthy and very good breakfast.
Some cooked meat, potato cakes, toast, fried egg and a tasty juice provide you with a very nourishing meal.
You can use any cooked meat and any fruit juice here.

questDatabase.name: Try to dry out the Nether
questDatabase.description:
Pumps can do more than pump oil and water. You can go to the nether and pump lava from the huge lava lakes too.
Don't forget to bring some tanks or fluid cells with you. Once you reach HV lava can be centrifuged for gold, silver, tin, copper, and a little tungstate.

This is a good use for your LV pumps once you upgrade to MV pumps for oil.

questDatabase.name: Diamond Tanks... Oh shiny
questDatabase.description: After you build a cutting machine you can make some diamond plates for your new 64 buckets single block tank.

questDatabase.name: New source of Glowstone
questDatabase.description: Find some glowflowers in the Nether and plant them in the Overworld. You will never need to go to the Nether and harvest glowstone again.

questDatabase.name: Did you run low on Gold or Redstone?
questDatabase.description:
Did you run low on redstone and gold? No problem with your glowstone flower farm. You can centrifuge glowstone dust to redstone and gold dust.
Redstone is also a good source of aluminium and chrome.

questDatabase.name: Diamond Chests... Oh shiny
questDatabase.description: After you build a cutting machine you can make some diamond plates for your new big diamond chests.

questDatabase.name: Even More Compact Storage
questDatabase.description: If you found enough gold you can upgrade your chest to make it an even bigger inventory of 9x9. You can just build a new chest or upgrade the iron chest with a wood to gold chest upgrade item. You can use an assembler to make them a little easier.

questDatabase.name: Scribing Tool
questDatabase.description: To unlock your researches you need a scribing tool and paper. Better make two of them. One for your research table and one for researches. You also need some paper and ink.

questDatabase.name: Bathing the warp effects away.
questDatabase.description: Litmus paper tell you how high you warp level is, but how can you get rid of the nasty warp effects? Bath salt will help you by prohibiting warp effects for a short period. Just throw the salt into a 1x1 water hole and jump inside. You will feel relieved a bit after bathing.

questDatabase.name: Bathing in a Spa. Automated Warp removing
questDatabase.description: Bathing in a spa will automate the process of temporary removing warp effects. Take the bath salt with you into the spa.

questDatabase.name: Temp warp remover Soap
questDatabase.description:
This soap is very special. It will remove temporary warp and has a small chance to also remove some normal warp, if you are lucky. Taking a bath first increases your chances.

Hint: You need to chisel your tallow block for the recipe to work.

questDatabase.name: Enchanting Table 1.0
questDatabase.description: Finally with your new wand and 50 stored vis you are able to build your own enchantment table. The recipe can be found on the GTNH Thaumcraft Page

questDatabase.name: Division Sigil
questDatabase.description:
Maybe you found a division sigil in a chest already. You have heard about some ritual to activate it.

You need an enchantment table, 8 redstone dust, a good sword and an animal you want to sacrifice at night. Catching and holding it with a lasso would be the easiest way.
Place your enchantment table on a grass field and surround it with redstone dust.
Precisely at midnight place the animal on or near the table and kill it.
Of course you also need to have your sigil on you.
Be aware! Your actions will have consequences.

questDatabase.name: Beacon
questDatabase.description: With your new wand you are able to create a beacon. The beacon recipe is found on the GTNH Thaumcraft Page. Activate it in your base to gain various positive effects.

questDatabase.name: Cursed Earth
questDatabase.description: Kill the monsters that spawn on the cursed earth. Use a shovel with the silk touch enchantment to dig up the cursed earth blocks. You will need these blocks for your mob spawner later.

questDatabase.name: Silky Jewel
questDatabase.description:
It's time to craft some silky jewels for your tinkers tools. Lots of blocks you can easily grab with this tool.

The recipe can be found on the GTNH page after researching the enchantment table.

questDatabase.name: Division Sigil Stable
questDatabase.description:
The second ritual will not be as easy as the first one. After this ritual your sigil will be stable enough to make stable unstable ingots which will not explode.

This ritual needs to be performed in The End dimension. 
The ritual is performed by placing a Beacon in the centre of a flat area of at least 11x11, not necessarily End Stone. Then place a chest in each of the cardinal directions leaving 4 spaces empty between the chest and the Beacon. In each chest insert these specific contents:

North: iron ingot, gold ingot and the other things listed in the task.
South: The different Ore Blocks and the other things listed in the task.
East: The potions.
West: The Music disks.

A spiral pattern of Redstone and String is then laid out around the beacon. At any time, Shift+Right-clicking the Beacon with an Activated Division Sigil in hand will show the building progress of the ritual.

Finally, kill an Iron Golem while it stands within the ritual area to activate the process. If it works, there will be an explosion that destroys the beacon and chests, while every Enderman in the End vanishes. During the ritual, throngs of aggresive mobs imbued with Haste will begin spawning and attacking the Player who needs to kill 100 of them to complete the ritual. If the Player dies or leaves the dimension, the ritual will fail and will have to be started over. Once enough mobs have been killed, the first activated Sigil in the inventory will stabilize. The Pseudo-Inversion Sigil can be used an unlimited number of times, and dividing an Iron Ingot by Diamond will produce Mobius "Unstable-Stable" Ingot which does not explode, can be produced in any crafting interface and will stack up to 64.

questDatabase.name: Blub blub blub.....
questDatabase.description:
The brewing stand is really important for brewing the various potions like night vision, healing, haste and jump. Toxic potions or splash potions can be created too. 
With your basic wand you can create one.

The recipes can be found on the GTNH page in the Thaumonomicon.

questDatabase.name: The Iron Guy
questDatabase.description:
Do you feel lonely? Need some extra protection in your base? Want to keep the pigmen off your back in the Nether?
They can do good amounts of damage and aggro enemies like the pigmen away from you. They can even take care of that pesky Vampire Pigman.
Craft some Iron Golems and the monster problem inside your base will be gone.

questDatabase.name: The Cool Guy
questDatabase.description:
Feeling lonely? Located far away from a smow biome?
Craft a Snow Golem, and perhaps challenge him to a snow ball fight.

questDatabase.name: Oh crunchy
questDatabase.description: After hours of doing Thaumcraft research you found a way to craft pure tears. Ichorium purifies the nether star which sucks all the warp away. Be careful, as this may have a deadly end.

questDatabase.name: Purge all your warp
questDatabase.description:
Did you ever have a dream where you could purge all your warp with no bad side effects? This purification talisman will let your dreams come true.
Do not forget to wear it.

questDatabase.name: A Chest for Bees
questDatabase.description: A chest for bees only. It can hold up to 125 different bees in one chest.

questDatabase.name: Frames
questDatabase.description:
Untreated frames are the simplest frames. They do not work in bee houses, only in apiaries. You will need them to craft bee houses.

They increase the bee's performance. Each untreated frame will double a bee's productivity.

questDatabase.name: Impregnated Frames
questDatabase.description:
Impregnated Frames are even better than untreated Frames. 
Each frame doubles the bee's productivity. It has a longer durability than the untreated frame, but a shorter one compared to the proven frame.

questDatabase.name: Proven Frame
questDatabase.description:
Proven frames are much better than impregnated ones.
Each frame doubles the bee's productivity. Out of the three Forestry frames (Untreated, Impregnated and Proven), the proven frame has the longest durability.

You can make them or purchase them from a villager. If you can't find a beekeeper, there are couple of different options to get one. Rescue a zombie villager, add doors to a village to get them to make kids, or perhaps use a cupid's bow and arrow...

questDatabase.name: Moron's Guide to Taller Trees
questDatabase.description:
Forestry trees have a variety of attributes.  Once you get a tree with a useful attribute, you can breed that attribute into other tree species. This way you can get an ultimate tree that combines all the attributes you want - including the type of fruit! These breeding lines do not cover every option or even the best, but are great starts to get you into Forestry.

IT IS RECOMMENDED YOU DO YOUR FORESTRY TREE BREEDING IN AN ENCLOSED AREA, OR UNDERGROUND. BUTTERFLIES ARE A KNOWN LAG SOURCE.

For faster tree breeding, enclose your trees so that butterflies cannot escape, and breed bees with better traits for area and pollination.

Girth - The width of your tree.  Wider trees have more leaves, but will also need more saplings to begin growing. All saplings must be the same species and girth. The sapling in the NW corner determines the stats of the new tree, and is where bone meal must be applied to mature the tree. Butternut already provides 2x2 girth.

Height - Controls how high the tree grows. Jungle trees are already Larger, but if you want Largest there is a guide to getting Cocobolo trees. There are rumors of rare villagers with Giant Sequoia saplings capable of reaching into the clouds...

Matures - The growth speed of a sapling into a tree.  Important if you plan to cut it down right away for logs.

Saplings - Chance of getting a sapling from a detroyed leaf. Balsa, a tree on the way to Cocobolo, has High number of saplings. Good for making into biomass or other uses.

Sappiness - The amount of biomass a sapling produces in the Fermenter. Boost Fermenter output more using honey or fruit juice. Blue Mahoe provides the highest sappiness, but Lemon and Plum are respectable.

Yield - Chances of getting a fruit from a destroyed leaf. Plum is the best here.

Fruit - Each fruit from various trees provides different advantages. Lemons are great sources of Fruit Juice but don't provide much Mulch for the fermenter. On the other hand, Plum is a mediocre source of Fruit Juice, but great for Mulch. The best seedoil nut is coconut, but butternut or hazelnut are good alternatives.

When breeding these trees for quests, you will need to breed the species "pure", not a hybrid.

questDatabase.name: Breed some cultivated bees
questDatabase.description:
Common Princess and Foresty Drone can be bred to cultivated bees. 

Cultivated bees have the shorest lifespan - this means they make great princesses to breed with your newly bred drones. The queen will die quickly, quickly giving genetic material to work with.  Make sure the traits you want are kept!

They are also a Fast production bee, which means lots of honey combs for powering your Beealyzer or Treealyzer. 

Cultivated Bees produce Honey Combs every 0.9 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time.

Make sure your cultivated bees are pure with a Beealyzer or GT scanner.

The main bee breeding quests will require pure bees but you can use Ignoble or Pristine princesses.

questDatabase.name: Breed some common bees
questDatabase.description:
To cross breed bees you need two different species of bees. One drone and one princess from different hives (Meadows and Forestry as an example)
Bee Houses do not allow crossbreeding. In an Apiary you can cross breed them to a new species. Certain frames will help this process. Shortening their lifespan means faster crosses. Increasing Mutation rate means getting rare bees quicker.

Common Bees produce Honey Combs every 2.2 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time. 

Make sure your bees are pure by checking their genetics with a Beealyzer or GT scanner.

questDatabase.name: Breed some noble bees
questDatabase.description:
Cross breeding common and cultivated bees can result in noble bees. 

Noble bees produce dripping combs every 3.8 minutes and honeydew. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time. 

You've heard of a drunk beekeeper saying he has perfected a method of creating proven frames using Honeydew and a little magic. It might be worth your time to try experimenting yourself.

questDatabase.name: Dripping Combs
questDatabase.description:
Your noble bees produce some dripping combs.
A good source for honey, and if have a magical mind, honeydew for proven frames.

questDatabase.name: Breed some majestic bees
questDatabase.description:
Cross breeding noble and cultivated bees can result in majestic bees.

Majestic bees have a very important attribute - high fertility. They will leave 4 drones when they die. This means lots of genetic material for the next generation to work with.

Majestic bees produce dripping combs every 1.5 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time.

questDatabase.name: Breed some imperial bees
questDatabase.description:
Cross breeding noble and majestic bees can result in imperial bees.

These bees produce a Regeneration buff in their active area.  You can probably find a use for this in case of...accidents.

Imperial bees produce dripping combs every 3.8 minutes and royal jelly every 5.1 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time. 

Royal jelly is needed in making scented paneling for an Alveary - the third tier bee housing.
