The Charm of Fanciful Thinking is the only way to protect oneself from some of the worst effects a nightmare can throw at you. It just needs to be in a player's inventory for it to function.

A Charm of Fanciful Thinking is crafted using Sticks and Fanciful Thread.

questDatabase.name: Digging faster!
questDatabase.description: The Dream Weaver of Iron Arm will add a mining speed boost to a player when they wake up from a good nights sleep. If the dream weaver is corrupted by a nearby Dream Weaver of Nightmares, the weaver will instead add a mining speed slowdown effect to the player.

questDatabase.name: Moving faster!
questDatabase.description:
The Dream Weaver of Fleet Foot will add a speed boost to a player when they wake up from a good night's sleep. 

If the dream weaver is corrupted by a nearby Dream Weaver of Nightmares, the weaver will instead add a slowdown effect to the player.

questDatabase.name: Hunger no more!
questDatabase.description: The Dream Weaver of Fasting will add a boost to the saturation of a player when they wake up from a good nights sleep, essentially meaning they will not get hungry for the duration of the effect. If the dream weaver is corrupted by a nearby Dream Weaver of Nightmares, the weaver will instead add a hunger effect to the player.

questDatabase.name: Mellifluous Hunger
questDatabase.description: Mellifluous Hunger is an ingredient used in other recipes. It is dropped when a Nightmare is killed.

questDatabase.name: Potion of flowing spirit
questDatabase.description:
The Brew of Flowing Spirit captures the essence of the Spirit World in liquid form. It can only be brewed in the Spirit World!

The Brew can be thrown at the ground and the liquid will burst out (the source block can later be picked up in a bucket). Standing in the liquid will have a minor healing effect for most creatures. Demonic or undead creatures will be weakened. Nightmares standing in the liquid will lose their invulnerability effect!

Having a pool of flowing spirit near a Dream Weaver of Nightmares will decrease the chance of a nightmare by 10 percent for each source block (up to 3).

questDatabase.name: We need another oven
questDatabase.description: First of all you can't visit any other dim to get materials. Not the Twilight Forest, not the Nether or the End. Lets start with crafting a new oven and a stack of jars to start with some basic ingredients. For 500 Coins you can tranfer it to the Spirit Dim.

questDatabase.name: More coins
questDatabase.description:
The second goal is to have a cauldron to make some mutandis but you need more coins anyways. 
You have two options here - killing a few nightmares to get coins or selling some wispy cotton.
You need to switch a few times between dimensions to compress the coins first.

questDatabase.name: Another Cauldron
questDatabase.description: After we have enough coins we can craft the cauldron and transfer it with 1000 coins to the spirit world.

questDatabase.name: Nightmares
questDatabase.description: Need more coins? Killing a few nightmares to get coins.

questDatabase.name: Wispy Cotton
questDatabase.description: Need more coins? Selling wispy cotton for coins.

questDatabase.name: Dreaming mutandis
questDatabase.description: Go and find some chicken and eggs, brew some Exhale of the Horned One in your oven and plant some mandrake. Make a stack of mutadis to get some witchery tree saplings. Gravel hoes are good enough for planting stuff.

questDatabase.name: Exhale of the dreaming horned one
questDatabase.description: For later use do a few Exhale of the Horned One.

questDatabase.name: Offerings in your dreams
questDatabase.description:
For all your offerings you'll need an altar too. The spinning wheel needs it also.
2000 coins are needed.

questDatabase.name: Kettle for the Spirit World
questDatabase.description: A kettle is needed in the spirit world too. For a fee of 1500 coins you can transfer it.

questDatabase.name: spinning your dreams
questDatabase.description: You need the spinning wheel for the fanciful thread to finally make the Potion of Flowing Spirit.

questDatabase.name: Fanciful Thread
questDatabase.description: Fanciful Thread is spun from Wispy Cotton using a Spinning Wheel. It is an ingredient used to make the Potion of Flowing Spirit. This can be brewed only in the spirit world.

questDatabase.name: Odour of Purity in dreams
questDatabase.description: For later use do a few Odour of Purity.

questDatabase.name: More Power now!
questDatabase.description: The Dream Weaver of Intensity has two effects, firstly it will add a very short night vision effect (or blindness if corrupted by a nightmare) to a player when they wake up from a good nights sleep. Secondly, it will intensify all other nearby dream weavers so that they have either a stronger (but shorter lasting) effect or their duration is increased.

questDatabase.name: Avengers, assemble! 2
questDatabase.description: Time to make the MV variant of the assembler.

questDatabase.name: Node upgrades
questDatabase.description:
Nodes can take many upgrades. For now, try building a World Interaction Upgrade.  With it, you can setup simple autocrafting. 

Put a WIU in a transfer node attached to a crafting table. On the other side of the table, the 3x3 area is now treated as a crafting grid.  Place items in inventories on the other side and if they make a valid recipe, the WIU will craft it.  To speed it up, you will need to wait until HV for stainless steel.

questDatabase.name: Reed and resin
questDatabase.description:
One of the first useful crops you'll get is Stickreed.  It's fast growing, and can produce sticky resin and sugarcane (harvest before it reaches full maturity). It's also great for crossing with other crops to raise their stats.

I'll trade you some fertilizer for 2 stacks of each.

questDatabase.name: Metals from the Earth
questDatabase.description:
With higher tier crops you can even increase your ore production. Mixing these fibers and leaves with crushed ores can quadruple your output, or you can convert them directly to tiny dusts. Later you can mix these materials to make purified ore with some UU matter.

Show me your ability to get these metal crops and I'll give you some more fertilizer and some decent stat seedbags of rarer crops. Good source crops are essence berries or any of the oreberries.

You will need the proper oreblock beneath the crop to reach 100 percent maturity. For best growing conditions use dirt in between the oreblock and the crop.

For Ferru and Aurelia you will have to use a block of metal instead of a GT oreblock - a vanilla oreblock automined from the Twilight Forest will work. WAILA will tell you if the crop will accept the block you are using.

questDatabase.name: Water water everywhere
questDatabase.description:
Even though you have to plant crops near the water, they don't actually get any hydration unless you apply water manually.  Make a hydration cell and use it on your crops to increase their growth speed. 

You can recycle empty cells in a centrifuge.

questDatabase.name: Feeling a little like a noob...
questDatabase.description:
So could you grow me some essence berries so I can level up?  You can plant the ones you get from the bushes, or breed up some.

As a reward, I'll give you a silly seed a friend of mine came up with. It will definitely keep you on your toes.

questDatabase.name: I prefer to call it Canola
questDatabase.description:
This crop is a great source of seed oil for your biodiesel needs.

You can try getting it from dandelions, cocoa, potatoes or lemons.

questDatabase.name: Better than milk
questDatabase.description: I haven't been feeling well lately.  Would you grow me some Terrawarts?  They are better than milk, since they only remove negative effects, and stack to 64. Really nice when fighting that Alchemist infernal!

questDatabase.name: Sweet tooth
questDatabase.description:
Sugarcane or Reed not keeping up with your sugary needs? Sugar beets give 8 sugar per beet. Potatoes or carrots should easily give you sugar beets.

Hmm, now I want some candy.  Give me some sugar from your beets. I'll share some with you.

questDatabase.name: Swipe swipe
questDatabase.description: Once you get some large fields, collecting the crops can be a real hassle. Make yourself the GT scythe, Sense, to make it 5x5 = 25 times easier.

questDatabase.name: Annealead Copper Cable
questDatabase.description: Want some annealead copper cable? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Gold Cable
questDatabase.description: Want some gold cable? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Cupronickel 2x Wire
questDatabase.description: Want some cupronickel wires? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Electrum 4x Wire
questDatabase.description: Want some electrum wires? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Find Bastnasite, Monazita and Neodymium
questDatabase.description:
A lot of EV machine parts need Neodymium. Rare Earth is a good source but on the Moon you can find a vein with pure Neodymium ore.

The Bastnasite is a great source of fluorine as well.

The vein can be found on moon at Y Level 20-40.

questDatabase.name: Source of Nickel
questDatabase.description:
Garnierite, Nickel, Cobaltite, and Pentlandite, sources of Nickel, can be found in the Twilight Forest at Y 10-40. In MV you'll need tons of Nickel for Cupronickel.

Find a Greatwood and Silverwood to unlock the Tier 0 quest What is That...? to open the Novice Thaumaturge tab and start your Twilight Forest adventure.

Note: You can find small quantities of Pentlandite ore in the Overworld.

questDatabase.name: Chemical Dehydrator
questDatabase.description: Dehydrate your grapes to raisins. Or make some Styrene, Benzene or Ethylene at MV. Either way, this device is a nice to have.

questDatabase.name: Synthetic Rubber
questDatabase.description:
Want to make some synthetic rubber like styrene-butadine rubber?
I'll show you a way you can get it. All you need is an Oil Cracker and a Distillation Tower. There are different ways to do it and this quest is only an example of how you can make it.

Fist step is to cracking your Naphtha with steam.

questDatabase.name: Silver 2x Cable
questDatabase.description: Want some silver cable? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Distillation
questDatabase.description: For the next steps you need a few fluids/gases like Benzene, Ethylene and Butadiene. Run your distillation tower a few cycles to get it.

questDatabase.name: Copper Cable
questDatabase.description: Want some copper cable? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Rubber Sheet
questDatabase.description: Want some rubber sheets? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Styrene
questDatabase.description: To get Styrene you can use the chemical dehydrator or your large chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: Ethylbenzene
questDatabase.description: Putting Benzene and Ethylene in the Chemical Reactor gives you Ethylbenzene.

questDatabase.name: Raw Styrene-Butadiene-Ruber
questDatabase.description:
Next step is Raw Styrene-Butadiene Rubber. Mix your Butadiene,  Styrene and Air (you can use oxygen as well) to make the dust. 

An HV chemical reactor is required.

questDatabase.name: Let's get some pipes
questDatabase.description: First we're gonna need some pipes to connect everything. Do not use these pipes in junctions or the items will choose which path to go at random and you don't want that.

questDatabase.name: Junctions
questDatabase.description: So how do we deal with junctions then? We use these pipes. They are smart and they will send everything where it needs to go, so if you make a junction make sure you put this pipe there.

questDatabase.name: Interacting with stuff
questDatabase.description:
That's all nice and all, but none of these pipes connect to chests and machines. What am I supposed to do with them?

I'm glad you asked. You are going to need a special pipe for that. This is a pipe you need to use to connect to machines and chests. You'll have to set it up with chips that we'll make soon.

questDatabase.name: Chips
questDatabase.description:
Now you need to make some chips to use in those interface pipes. These ones do not do anything but are needed as a material for crafting the others.

Now would be a good time to look into IC2 crops to get all the dyes you will need for your advanced chips.

questDatabase.name: Item responder chip
questDatabase.description: This chip also stores items in connected invetory. It designates a storage for items that are set in the filter of this chip. They do not actively request for items they only serve as a destination for items to go. You can open up the menu by rightclicking the chip. There you can set which items should it accept and the priority. Items will go to item responders with higher priority first.

questDatabase.name: Item overflow chip
questDatabase.description:
This chip stores the items in connecting inventory. It designates a storage for items that have no other place to go. It is strongly recomended to have a default storage for items in every pipe system, otherwise bad stuff can happen. Best used with some large chest (diamond one for example).

It seems to have some bugs though, so don't craft more than one without testing it first.

You might have to just use a normal item responder and add the items you want routed back to you overflow spot.

questDatabase.name: Dynamic item responder
questDatabase.description: Dynamic item responder chip behaves exatly like an item responder chip, but instead of you setting up which items it should accept, it looks in the chest what items are there and those items it will accept.

questDatabase.name: Item extractor chip
questDatabase.description:
This chip will extract items from the connecting inventory. The extracted items then look for pipes with item responder chips where there's a free space they could go. If they don't find any they will go to the overflow default storage chest.

If you want it to extract everything leave the filter empty and set it to blacklist.

questDatabase.name: Item broadcaster
questDatabase.description:
Item broadcaster is a chip that tells everyone in the pipe system what items it has in the connecting inventory and if anyone needs anything it will send it to them. Right click it to set the items it will transmit. If you leave it empty and set to blacklist it will transmit everything.

Definitely use one in combination with an item overflow chip on your default storage chest. That way overflow will end up in the chest, but will be useable by the rest of your system.

questDatabase.name: Item stock keeper chip
questDatabase.description:
Item stock keeper looks at the connecting inventory and keeps item stocked in there. If the item is missing it will keep bothering item broadcasters every few seconds if they have the item and if they can send it. It's basically like an annoying child. 

It is really useful though. Want a chest that will always have 64 cobble and dirt in it and if you take them they will get replaced? This guy is perfect for that job. It's great for keeping  machines stocked. When stocking GT machines, the top left slot of the 3x3 is equal to the left slot of the machine.  Want a chemical reactor that keeps 3 hydrogen cells ready to go to make ammonia, just add nitrogen?  This is the chip for you.

questDatabase.name: Crafting chip
questDatabase.description: Crafting chip does exactly what it says. It's not just for default crafting. You can use it with GT machines. Just put in the matrix that it should insert and the output is what it should extract. Great use for them is in combination with fluid canners or super tanks for filling cells. I would strongly recommend not overusing them. Wait untill you have access to AE2 for autocrafting stuff.

questDatabase.name: Request pipe
questDatabase.description: This pipe let's you request stuff from the system. It shows all items that are avaible thanks to broadcast chips and even stuff that can be crafted thanks to crafting chips.

questDatabase.name: Simple storage system
questDatabase.description: Time to build a simple system to store your stuff. Place down the drawer controller and place the drawers around it. Connect the interface pipe to the drawer controller and put the dynamic item responder and broadcaster chips inside. Don't forget to set the broadcaster to transmit everything by leaving the filter empty and setting it to blacklist. Now you can request stuff from your storage and if you have a chest with a pipe and extractor chip everything you put inside will be sorted into the storage.

questDatabase.name: Desulfuring oil automation
questDatabase.description: This quest line will show you how to automate desulfuring of oil products. Return here once you have unlocked the LV distillery quest and have some polyethylene plates.

questDatabase.name: Storing the fluids
questDatabase.description:
First we should make some place to store all the fluids we'll use. 2 super tanks are required for this quest but you'll need one more later so it's better to build 3 right now.

If you're interested what they'll be used for:
1 for oxygen
1 for hydrogen
1 for sulfuric acid

questDatabase.name: Electrolyzing water
questDatabase.description:
Now let's automate electrolyzing water into oxygen and hydrogen. You'll need hydrogen for tons of stuff including desulfurization, obtaining tungsten, and nitric acid production. Oxygen is also useful as I'm sure you noticed when making steel.

How to set it up:

Place the electrolyzer down and connect it to water and electricity. Place the 2 super tanks nearby. Set the electrolyzer to produce hydrogen gas and oxygen cells. Use normal GT fluid pipes to output the hydrogen gas into one super tank. That is now your hydrogen storage. Now connect interface pipes to all 3 machines.

For the electrolyzer put in item stock keeper set to keep 2 empty cells stored. Also put in extractor set to extract oxygen cells.

Now for the oxygen storage put it item responder chip set to accept oxygen cells and extractor set to extract empty cells.

Now put some empty cells inside your default storage chest and don't forget to have a broadcaster there.

questDatabase.name: Desulfuring the oil
questDatabase.description:
Now it's time to start the actual desulfurization. Use a chemical reactor of your choice, fill it with sulfuric light fuel and hook it to power. Now connect an interface pipe to it. Put an item stock keeper inside set to store 4 hydrogen cells. Then put in item extractor set to extract Hydrogen sulfide and empty cell.

Go to your hydrogen storage super tank and put in a crafting chip set to make one hydrogen cell from one empty cell.

And that's all.

questDatabase.name: Dealing with H2S
questDatabase.description:
Now let's convert all that H2S into sulfuric acid. Hook up a chemical reactor to electricity, water and interface pipe. Put inside an item responder chip set to accept H2S cells and extract empty cells. Distill that diluted sulfuric acid in distillery and store it in super tank.

Congratulations. You now have a completely automatic desulfuring of oil, automatic production of hydrogen and oxygen and you also store all that sulfuric acid.

questDatabase.name: Small reward
questDatabase.description: Here's a small reward for making all those chips.

questDatabase.name: Reward for desulfuring automation
questDatabase.description:
The greatest reward is having your stuff automated if you've done everything correctly, but here's a reward for making it this far.

Some other setups to look at automating are making polyethylene and nitric acid. 

With stock keeper chips you can always keep a set amount on-hand and when you pull out the cells to use elsewhere, your setup will automatically make more.

questDatabase.name: There can be only one...
questDatabase.description:
...so make them lose their heads. 

Make yourself a Cleaver with your tool forge and collect some wither skeleton skulls.

If you have problems finding wither skeletons, once you get to HV you can put a powered skeleton spawner in the Nether.

questDatabase.name: Salt for your salty mouth
questDatabase.description: Modpack too easy? Tired of all the quests making the game trivial? Hateposting in github about the noobs making steam too powerful? Well here's a quest for you to turn all those OP coins into salt.

questDatabase.name: Now I feel bad...
questDatabase.description: ...that I know creepers have hearts.  Extract a few with your Arthana.  You might want to add a few levels of Looting to get more drops.

questDatabase.name: Rumplestiltskin!
questDatabase.description:
Spinning hay into gold sounds like a fairy tale, but with your new magical spinning wheel you too can try tricking a queen into giving you their first born child.

You will need three for your witchwear, and can turn extra into gold nuggets in a furnace.

questDatabase.name: Leather goddess of Robe-us
questDatabase.description: To make appropriate witchwear, you'll need to make some impregnated leather with your diamond vapor.

questDatabase.name: The witch is back...
questDatabase.description:
...and you're going to be in trouble. 

Dress for success in your new Witches Hat and Robes. A girl has to look her best, so I'll give you a nice bag as reward.

Check NEI uses for impregnated leather for other accessories to your outfit.

questDatabase.name: Books are for nerds...
questDatabase.description: ...And sexy male librarians. And also smart witches who want to learn their way around.  Craft the first group of Witchery books.

questDatabase.name: Going to need a big hat...
questDatabase.description: ...to fit all this knowledge.  Get some more books!

questDatabase.name: A dark path to travel down...
questDatabase.description: ...but a path laden with power beyond imagination. Behold mortal, and be terrified!

questDatabase.name: Power of a jet engine...
questDatabase.description:
The Large Gas Turbine lets you burn gaseous fuels like hydrogen, methane, or benzene. You'll have plenty to turn into EV EU with your new distillation tower.
Just like the Large Steam Turbine, the LGT uses turbine rotors. Use a fluid regulator to optimize the flow of gases into the turbine - not enough or too much will cause its output to drop.

Make sure your dynamo hatch is rated for the amount of EU your rotor will make!

questDatabase.name: Akihabra
questDatabase.description: Tired of talking one by one with every villager to determine their trades?  A trading post will show you all available trades from villagers in the area.  You'll need an Assembler to finish it up.

questDatabase.name: Automating power on/off
questDatabase.description:
Once you have a GT boiler or Large Combusion Engine with a faster startup time, you can automate it to produce power on-demand. Use a machine controller cover on the controller (protip: You can put it on the bottom, or on the side next to a casing, casings will transmit redstone signal). 
With a machine controller cover, you can use redstone to turn the machine on and off. This is handy if you don't want to use a soft hammer to disable a machine.
 
The best way to do that is with an RS latch. One input will turn the machine on, and one input will turn the machine off.
Use a comparator attached to a valve to measure the steam level in your multiblock Iron or Steel Tank. Invert the signal to turn on your boiler when the steam level is low. When the steam level signal is high, turn your boiler off. Use a trail of redstone to lower the signal strength. Because of boiler/turbine warmup, try to set the ON strength to 30 percent of capacity and OFF strength to about 90 percent.

Red alloy wire will hold a redstone signal for a longer distance.

You can use a Energy Detector Cover in Normal Electrical Storage (including batteries) mode to monitor the power in a battery buffer and use it to enable/disable generators in a similar way. Change mode using a screwdriver.

questDatabase.name: One Dragon Egg is not enough Mr Bond
questDatabase.description:
Dragon eggs are very rare and only drop after a dragon's death. How about I show you a way to recreate this powerful item out of a monster spawn egg?

Lets start with step one. Using a mob spawn egg, growth medium, and bacteria to create a bigger egg. This process needs one hour. 

Be sure your cleanroom is 100 percent clean or you will risk loosing the item.

If you have not been on Mars yet you have to wait until you can make mutagen for the next step. It is on the EV tab after visiting Mars.

questDatabase.name: Egg mutation
questDatabase.description:
After you found a way to make bacterial sludge stronger and research mutagen try soaking your bigger egg in it. You need to wait a bit (up to one hour).

Next use your bigger egg, a stack of uranium 238 (be sure you wear your hazamuit suit), and mutagen. Your cleanroom must be 100 percent clean before you start the process.

questDatabase.name: Ender Egg
questDatabase.description: Next step you must infuse your egg with endium dust and molten ender to get a ender egg. This process needs 1 hour. Your cleanroom must be 100 percent clean before you start the process.

questDatabase.name: Draconium Egg
questDatabase.description: Next step is to add draconium and ender goo to the ender egg to get a draconium egg. This process takes 1 hour. Your cleanroom must be 100 percent clean before you start the process.

questDatabase.name: Dragon Egg Omlet
questDatabase.description: The last step to create you dragon egg is to add enderium and a dragon heart to the draconium egg. This process takes 1 hour. Your cleanroom must be 100 percent clean before you start the process.

questDatabase.name: Styrene-Butadine Rubber Sheet
questDatabase.description: Now we add a bit sulfur to the raw dust and get molten styrene-butadiene rubber. Use a Plate mold to get plates.

questDatabase.name: Silicone Rubber
questDatabase.description:
Want to make some synthetic rubber like Silicone Rubber?
There are different ways to do it and this quest is only an example of how you can make it.

First step you need Chloromethane. 

You can use 2 Chlorine and 1 Methane per Chloromethane in your chemical reactor.

Alternatively you can use Methanol and Hydrochloric Acid.

questDatabase.name: Dimethyldichlorosilane
questDatabase.description: For the next steps you need Chloromethane and Silicon Dust.  Finally you get Dimethyldichlorosilane.

questDatabase.name: Polydimethylsiloxane Dust
questDatabase.description: Put Dimethyldichlorosilane and Water into the chemical reactor and get Polydimethylsiloxane.

questDatabase.name: Silicone Rubber Sheet
questDatabase.description: Now we add a bit of sulfur to the polydimethylsiloxane dust and get molten silicone rubber. Use a Plate mold to get plates.

questDatabase.name: HSS-S
questDatabase.description: Now that you have HSS-G, it's time to make HSS-S. This new alloy is an important part of a lot of IV, LuV and ZPM recipes.

questDatabase.name: Argon
questDatabase.description:
To process some of the new ingots you will find, you need argon. Your first source will come from air, in small amounts.

Hint: Use compresed air in a vacuum freezer and get liquid air. This will be a source of argon.

questDatabase.name: Naquadah
questDatabase.description:
On Ceres you can find small naquadah ores. Now that you have the dust and argon, you can make some naquadah ingots.
Your EBF needs HSS-G heating coils.

questDatabase.name: HSSG
questDatabase.description:
After you can make Tungsten Steel and may upgrade your Electric Blastfurnace with new Coils you are able to make HSS-G Ingots. This ingot becomes very important in LuV tier.
Hss-g is made out of tungstensteel, chrome, molydenum and vanadium dust.

questDatabase.name: IV Circuit Assembler
questDatabase.description: The IV circuit assembler will let you make easier MV circuits, as well as single step EV circuits.

questDatabase.name: Naquadah Doped Monocrystalline Silicon
questDatabase.description: To make the most advanced wafers, you need to make naquadah dopped monocrystalline silicon first. The process takes 750 seconds and requires silicon blocks and a naquadah ingot in the Electric Blast Furnace. You can make 64 wafers out of every boule.

questDatabase.name: Naquadah Doped Wafer
questDatabase.description: To create some naquadah doped silicon wafers, place the monocrystalline naquadah doped silicon boule in a cutting machine. An HV cutting machine is needed for future advanced wafers and chips.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun at EV Level
questDatabase.description: The next solar panel you can make is the EV one. It generates 2048 EU/t max. Most GregTech machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce  quadruple sunnarium plate. The Avaritia 9x9 dire crafting table is required to make this panel.

questDatabase.name: SoC - System on a chip
questDatabase.description: To make Lv and MV circuits much cheaper you need soc's. System on a chip.

questDatabase.name: Cheaper MV circuits
questDatabase.description: With the IV circuit assembler and SoC's you can now make integrated processors for a reduced price.

questDatabase.name: Glass Fiber
questDatabase.description:
Glass Fiber is used in Fiber Reinforced Boards for circuits.
Borax can be extracted out of Salt ores. Electrolyze it to get Boron and mix it with Glass dust.
The ingots can be turned into glass fiber in the wiremill.

questDatabase.name: Fiber Reinforced Epoxid Sheet
questDatabase.description: Fiber Reinforced Epoxid Sheets are needed for the more advanced circuits. Mix glass fiber with epoxid to get your sheets. Alternatively you can use raw carbon fiber.

questDatabase.name: Empty Fiber Reinforced Glass Board
questDatabase.description: Fiber Reinforced circuit boards require fiber reinforced epoxid resin sheets, copper foil and sulfuric acid to make an empty board. By adding annealed copper foil and Iron(III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate you can craft a More Advanced Circuit Board.

questDatabase.name: Single step EV circuits
questDatabase.description: Quantumprocessors are your first chance to make EV circuits in a single craft.

questDatabase.name: Qbit Wafer and Chip
questDatabase.description:
The Qbit Wafer is made out ofa Nano CPU Wafer and quantum eyes. Cut it for Qbit processor chips.
A cleanroom is needed.

questDatabase.name: Thought emitters were bad enough?
questDatabase.description: Field generators are a big part of lategame crafts, and yes they always suck to make.

questDatabase.name: Accelerating things II
questDatabase.description: While the ender quarry on its own with speed upgrade is good, why not speed it up a little bit more?

questDatabase.name: Accelerating things III
questDatabase.description: If Speed upgrade II is to slow craft a speed upgrade III.

questDatabase.name: LuV Circuits Assembler
questDatabase.description: The LuV circuit assembler is a nice one, giving you both cheaper HV circuits, as well as IV-UV circuits.

questDatabase.name: Cheaper HV circuits
questDatabase.description: Now you can make nanocircuits in a single simple step. They cost a new wafer, the ASoC wafer. They get more useful in zpm to make cheaper EV circuits as well.

questDatabase.name: ASoc Advanced System on a chip
questDatabase.description: To make HV and EV circuits much cheaper you need ASoCs. Advanced system on a chip.

questDatabase.name: Crystalprocessors
questDatabase.description: Now that you're this far into LuV, you can make easier IV circuits, as well as your first UV circuit.

questDatabase.name: Crystal Chips
questDatabase.description: To make these chips you need Europium, as well as an HV Autoclave in the Asteroid Field dimension to achieve "low gravity".

questDatabase.name: Elite Circuit Board
questDatabase.description: Elite circuit boards require a fiber reinforced board, platinum foil and sulfuric acid to make an multilayer reinforced  board. By adding again platinum foil and Iron(III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate you can craft an elite circuit board.

questDatabase.name: LuV Laser Engraver
questDatabase.description: The LuV laser engraver is an important part of lategame circuit production. You need to make crystal CPU's for both wetwares, and crystalprocessors, the cheaper IV circuit.

questDatabase.name: Tier 6 > Tier 7
questDatabase.description: Three Tier 6 lootbags give a better one = Tier 7.

questDatabase.name: Polybenzimidazole
questDatabase.description:
Polybenzimidazole is a synthetic fiber used in ZPM Hulls and in high tier solar panels. It has many steps to produce it. Let's start with the bas eingredients.

First we make some chlorobenzene out of benzene and chlorine.

questDatabase.name: Nitration mixture
questDatabase.description: We also need nitration mixture. We can do it out of nitric acid and sulfuric acid.

questDatabase.name: 2-Nitrochlorobenzene
questDatabase.description: Next step is to mixing the nitration mixture with your chlorbenzene in the hv chemical reactor  to get 2-nitrochlorobenzene.

questDatabase.name: 3,3 Dichlorobenzidine
questDatabase.description: Mixing 2-nitrochlorbenzene with tiny copper dust gives you 3,3 Dichlorobenzidine in an EV Chemical Reactor.

questDatabase.name: 3,3 Diaminobenzidine
questDatabase.description: Mixing 3,3 Dichlorobenzidine with Ammonia and Zinc in an IV Chemical Reactor gives you 3,3 Diaminobenzidine.

questDatabase.name: Chemical reactions at IV level
questDatabase.description:
High tier chemical recipes need a high tier IV chemical reactor.

Alternativly you can use your Large Chemical Rector with two EV or one IV energy hatch.

questDatabase.name: Polybenzimidazole finally
questDatabase.description: 3,3 Diaminobenzidine and Diphenyl Isophtalate will finally give you molten Polybenzimidazole. Use a plate mold to get plates.

questDatabase.name: Diphenyl Isophtalate
questDatabase.description: Mix Sulfuric Acid, Phtalic acid and Phenol to get Diphenyl Isophtalate. An IV Chemical Reactor is needed.

questDatabase.name: Phenol
questDatabase.description: You can get Phenol in different ways, but why not try using your chlorobenzene and some water.

questDatabase.name: Phtalic acid
questDatabase.description: To get Phtalic acid you need mix Dimethylbenzene, tiny piles of Potassium Dichromate and Oxygen in an EV Chemical Reactor.

questDatabase.name: Dimethylbenzene
questDatabase.description: Dimethylbenzene can be distilled from Wood Tar or using Benzene and Methane gas in a Chemical Reactor.

questDatabase.name: Potassium Dichromate
questDatabase.description: Potassium Dichromate is made out of Potassium Nitrade and Chromium Dioxide in an HV Chemical Reactor.

questDatabase.name: Potassium Nitrate
questDatabase.description: Potassium Nitrade is made out of potassium and nitric acid.

questDatabase.name: Chromium Trioxide
questDatabase.description: Chromiumtroxide is be made out of chrome and oxygen in two steps. First you make chromiumoxide and then chromiumtrioxide.

questDatabase.name: Quantum Processor Assembly
questDatabase.description: Quantumprocessor Assembly is a IV Circuit. A cleanroom is needed.

questDatabase.name: Master Quantum Computer
questDatabase.description: The Master Quantumcomputer is an LuV Circuit and needs a cleanroom.

questDatabase.name: Quantum Processor Mainframe
questDatabase.description: The Quantumprocessor Mainframe is the first ZPM circuit you can make.

questDatabase.name: Crystalprocessor Assembly
questDatabase.description: The Crystal Processor Assembly is a LuV Circuit. A cleanroom is needed.

questDatabase.name: Ultimate Crystal Computer
questDatabase.description: The Ultimate Crystalcomputer is a ZPM circuit. A cleanroom is needed.

questDatabase.name: Crystalprocessor Mainframe
questDatabase.description: The Crystalprocessor Mainframe is the first UV circuit you can make. A cleanroom is needed.

questDatabase.name: Superconductors 32768 eu/t
questDatabase.description:
How about lossless 32768 EU IV wires? Tetraindiumditindibariumtitaniumheptacoppertetrakaidekaoxide is a superconductor wire and will transfer your energy without any loss. Every voltage now has superconductor wires and a base wire with only a very small EU/t loss.

Mix indium, tin, barium, tianium, copper and oxygen in an EV mixer. Now you have the base dust, which needs an EBF with Naquadah coils, and a vacuum freezer to cool it down.

Make some LuV superconductor base wires and use an assembler to combine these wires with nitrogen, helium and tiny enderium pipes and an LuV pump to get your 32768 EU/t superconductor wires.

questDatabase.name: Cheaper LV circuits
questDatabase.description: With the IV circuit assembler and SoC's you can now make a microprocessor for a reduced price.

questDatabase.name: Simple SoC - System on a chip
questDatabase.description: For a replacement for vacuum tubes in simple circuits you'll need simple SoC's. System on a chip.

questDatabase.name: Cheaper Simple Circuit
questDatabase.description: The NAND chip is an industrial replacement for the vacuum tubes that is much cheaper.

questDatabase.name: On your way to Tier 4 DIMs
questDatabase.description: Tier 4 Planets are Jupiter's Moon Io where you will find the next dungeon, Venus (needs a SpaceSuit) and Mercury.

questDatabase.name: Iridium Mix
questDatabase.description:
Nickel, Iridium Palladium and Mithril you can find on Io or Venus. Look at Y 15-40.
You can get also Osmium out of Iridium Ore for high tier materials you need later.

questDatabase.name: Venus Trip
questDatabase.description:
Venus has two ore mixes you really want to find. One mix is the Quantium Mix and the other is Naquadah.

Make sure you are wearing proper protective equipment!

Quantium is found at Y 5-25 and Naquadah Y 10-90.

questDatabase.name: Yttrium-Barium-Cuprate
questDatabase.description: Yttrium-Barium-Cuperate becomes more important in LuV Tier. It needs an EV Mixer to mix and a Electric Blast furnace with Tungsten Steel heating coils.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 1x1 EV
questDatabase.description: Put those 2048 EU panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an IV assembler to combine the panel with an EV hull, a battery, and a robot arm. This panel doesn't need to be cleaned manually.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun at IV Level
questDatabase.description: The next solar panel you can make is the IV one. It generates 8192 EU/t max. Most GregTech machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce sunnarium alloy out of reinforced iridium and sunnarium. The Avaritia 9x9 dire crafting table is required to make this panel.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 1x1 IV
questDatabase.description: Put those 8192 EU panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an LuV assembler to combine the panel with an IV hull, a battery, and a robot arm. This panel doesn't need to be cleaned manually.

questDatabase.name: LuV Assembler
questDatabase.description: The LuV assembler is needed for IV Solar Panels and other high tier stuff. Lets build one.

questDatabase.name: IO Dungeon
questDatabase.description:
After hours and hours and endless swimming in lava you will find a Io dungeon. A big hole will show you the way to the dungeon. Go and fight some mobs before you have to kill the Boss Monster. It will drop the key for the chest with the schematics for tier 5 rockets.

This will open the Moons from Saturn and Uranus.

questDatabase.name: Tier 5 Heavy Duty Plates
questDatabase.description: Rockets require heavy duty plates for the main hull. Let's craft 60 tier 5 heavy duty plates out of tier 4 plates and compressed quantium plates.

questDatabase.name: Tier 5 Schematic
questDatabase.description: Each rocket needs a construction plan. Scan it in an HV Scanner and put the construction data on a Data Stick. The fourth tier schematic circuit uses an elite circuit and a heavy duty plate tier 5 and the data stick in a LuV circuit assembler.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Tier 5
questDatabase.description: After a month of hard work and ten thousand stacks of iTNT your fifth rocket is finally ready. But before you can go to Saturn and Uranus Moons you need to craft a few more things.

questDatabase.name: Heavy Duty Nose Cone Tier 3
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs a nose cone. Tier 5 rocket needs a heavy nose cone tier 3.

questDatabase.name: Heavy Duty Rocket Engine Tier 3
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs a rocket engine. A heavy one tier 3 is needed in the tier 5 rocket.

questDatabase.name: Heavy Duty Rocket Fins Tier 3
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs a few rocket fins. Tier 5 rockets need heavy ones Tier 3.

questDatabase.name: Large Fuel Canisters
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs fuel storage canisters. For the tier 5 rocket you need to craft two medium and two large canisters.

questDatabase.name: Booster Tier 2
questDatabase.description: The distance between Planets and Moons is much larger now so the rocket needs bigger boosters to reach it.

questDatabase.name: EVA equipment
questDatabase.description: Who wants to trudge around on the surface when you can fly? Upgrade your chestplate with a jetpack and fly around Venus.

questDatabase.name: Journey to the bottom of a molten ocean
questDatabase.description: Venus is hot, so hot it can melt lead. On top of that the atmosphere is so thick, 90x the Overworld, that it will crush you. Not to mention the Sulfuric Acid! You will need to construct a special suit to survive on Venus without dying instantly.

questDatabase.name: Gravity boots
questDatabase.description: These boots will help you fall faster in low gravity environments.  Or not. Maybe. Give them a try.

questDatabase.name: Bowl full of spaghetti
questDatabase.description:
Or at least factories full of item pipes. With these simple item pipes and conveyors you can take items out of one machine and feed them immediately into a second machine.
Later you can make better item pipes. Look for "item pipe"  in NEI for options.

questDatabase.name: Pipes, pipes everywhere
questDatabase.description:
Now that you are in MV, you will want to start automating processes. Polyethylene, O2, N2, H2, rubber, charcoal, etc. Faster item pipes will help with transporting items quickly around your base. For now, use your spiffy new extruder to craft some brass item pipes. 

The reward - restrictive item pipes - allow you to prioritize destinations. Locations on the other side of a restrictive pipe are treated as much further away than locations on the same side of a pipe. Very handy when you want overflow (or non-matching) items to go somewhere else!

For higher tiers, look up "* item pipe" in NEI.

questDatabase.name: More Red, less Wheat
questDatabase.description:
When breeding together crops for an output crop, try to get crops that are close in tier to the output crop, and have similar attributes to the output crop. 

For example, Redwheat has "Red", "Wheat" and "Redstone" attributes and is tier 6. Netherwart has "Red" and is tier 5. Use the cropnalyzer crop prediction mode to see how many points Redwheat has using two Netherwart. 

You'll also want to make sure the light level is between 5-10 for the cross breeding to occur. 

Really though, once you get to MV it's better to make a Glowstone crop and centrifuge it for redstone. Red wheat == Dead wheat

questDatabase.name: When all you have is a hammer...
questDatabase.description:
...the whole world looks like a nail.  When looking for good tool materials, look for the generic tool in NEI and use R to find the recipe. Then use U on the source materials you have to find out their durability options. Tool parts are normally not in NEI, like the drill bit. So use NEI U on plates etc to figure out their recipes. 

The GT tools each have special uses.

Screwdriver - Used on covers to change their behavior.

Wrench - Used to change the output direction on a GT machine, or to break it. Can also disconnect/connect pipes or enable their built in shutter.

Crowbar - Remove covers from machines or pipes.

Wire cutters - Connecting/disconnecting wires/cables.

Soft mallet - Turning machines on/off.

Hammer - Prospecting for ores in a limited way in front of you, and smashing ore blocks into crushed ores.

questDatabase.name: Farming a little easier
questDatabase.description: Tired of the forestry farms requirements? The Ender IO Farming Station is available to ease your suffering.  It just requires EU and can be easily upgraded with capacitors.  Most normal crops and trees work with it, but unfortunately IC2 crops do not.

questDatabase.name: Do you hear that engine revving?
questDatabase.description:
Your old and trusty combustion engines don't quite cut it anymore, not to mention they are polluting the place. If you want to keep burning liquids, you need to build a better engine. This multiblock can produce 1A of EV voltage by default and 3A if you supply it with oxygen. However, this power doesn't come for free - you need to supply the machine with small amounts of lubricant constantly (and oxygen if you want to boost both its efficiency and output).

You will also require 3 Input Hatches, a Muffler, and a Dynamo Hatch. Their tiers are up to you.

Cetane Boosted Diesel and High Octane Gasoline are excellent fuel sources for this engine.

You will need to keep the area in front of the engine clear so it can pull enough air - not even torches.

questDatabase.name: Nice Nether Trees
questDatabase.description:
There are a few very useful Nether trees out there which gives resources like Redstone, Gunpowder, Bonemeal or Fertilizer.

Go and get a few trees like Bloodwood, Fusewood, Darkwood or Ghostwood out of the Nether.

These trees can be planted like normal trees, except for Bloodwood.  That has to planted on a ceiling and will grow down instead of up.

questDatabase.name: Helium 3 and Saltwater on Moon
questDatabase.description:
The Moon is rich in Helium 3 because the Sun has been embedding it in the upper layer of moon by the solar wind over billions of years. 
Salt water is also available in smaller quantities. You will want plenty of chlorine for processing Rutile to get Titanium. 

There are more planets and moons with gas and fluids underneath the surface.  Bring along a multiblock fluid drill to recover these fluids.

questDatabase.name: Saltwater and Chlorobenzene on Mars
questDatabase.description:
Mars is rich on saltwater and chlorobenzene. If yu run low on chlorine you can centrifuge the fluids.

More Fluids and Gases can be found on (This list is subject to change due to balancing at any time!):

Salt water

  Moon - v low
  Mars - Low
  Europa - High

Helium3

  Moon - V.Low
  Mercury - Low/High

Chlorobenzene

  Mars - V.Low

Nitrogen

  Triton - high
  Pluto - high

Methane

  Titan - High

Ethane

  Titan - Low

Ethylene

  Triton - Low

Callisto

  Oxygen - Low

Super Heavy Oil

  Europa - low
  BarnardC - high
  TCetiE - low

Molten Naquadria

  BarnardC - Low
  VegaB - high

Molten Naquadha

  Venus - V.Low
  Titan - low
  Haumea - high

Liquid air 

  Callisto- Low
  Charon - Medium
  BarnardE - High

questDatabase.name: Chemical lesson part two
questDatabase.description:
More advanced recipes need an mv chemical reactor like polyethylen.

Hint: You can use the battery slot and other extra slot in the GUI to store unused configuration circuits.

questDatabase.name: Welcome to OpenComputers!
questDatabase.description: Hello there, my name is Teirdalin and today we shall embark on one of the most exciting and fun mods;  OpenComputers!  First things first though, you will need some patience to get through this mod, but it will certainly pay off in the end!

questDatabase.name: Your First Microchip
questDatabase.description: Microchips will be used in most things you make, so if possible; I suggest bulk crafting quite a few of these.

questDatabase.name: Your First Computer
questDatabase.description: Place the power converter you gotten earlier near an electircal cable and connect it with your wire cutters.   Now place your computer case by the converter and by the magic of technology it shall fuel the computer case!  Now take your hard drive, memory and graphics cards and place them inside, place the disk drive next to the computer and insertin the operating system disk.  Insert the bios we made into the case and turn it on.

questDatabase.name: Arithmetic Logic Circuits
questDatabase.description:
The Arithmetic Logic Circuits are used in numerous parts;  mostly in groups of 8-16 upto 64.   
So make sure to make plenty.

questDatabase.name: All Your Card Are Belong To Us
questDatabase.description:
Card bases are just as you might think they are;  they're the base part that each card you make will use to connect onto the motherboard.

I suggest making a handful of these for future cards.

questDatabase.name: Short Term Memory
questDatabase.description:
Gotta get more ram.

Memory, or ramis essentially a temporary storage of data on your computer that can be rapidly accessed via your programs..
Hence the name Rapid Access Memory.

questDatabase.name: Woah Rad Graphics!
questDatabase.description:
See the digital world.

Your graphics card allows the computer to draw text and other things to the screen. 
The better graphics card you use the higher resolution, and better features can be drawn.

You also need a higher tier monitor to display colors or to get touchscreen compatability-
but that's something to worry about for another day.

questDatabase.name: Control Units
questDatabase.description: So controlling! Strangely enough, this part takes an HV circuit to craft; so here's some to make your first computer parts in exchange for MV circuits in their place.  Don't spend them all in one place!

questDatabase.name: What did the data say to the CPU?
questDatabase.description:
Cache me outside.

Your CPU will essentially be how fast your computer processes data. 
A stronger CPU == A faster computer.

questDatabase.name: Computer Case
questDatabase.description:
100 Percent Waterproof.


The computer base is the HUB of all your computer parts essentially.
It takes two memory sticks, a BIOs rom, a CPU, and a hard drive at the very least to run your computer.

The power converter allows you to power it from your GregTech power grid, and the floppy drive will allow you to install your operating system onto the hard drive.   Both parts are essential but both for some strange reason requires the T2 microchips to craft; so here's a starting pair using T1 Microchips instead- Don't lose them!

questDatabase.name: My Little Scrench
questDatabase.description: A screwdriver and wrench in one.  Not really a necessary tool, but has some purposes; I suggest referring to your computer manual.

questDatabase.name: HDD
questDatabase.description:
Your hard drive is where all your programs and data is stored..

You're playing minecraft, you should already know this though.

questDatabase.name: Not Your Average Platter
questDatabase.description: We'll need these for our hard drives.

questDatabase.name: BIOS
questDatabase.description:
The rom disks are necessary to get your computer to start, they're also what you use to run a drone off from.
Your BIOs go onto these little disks,  get me a blank and I'll write the basic BIOs onto it for you.

You can do this later when you make more computers by flashing your existing bios onto new cards or combining a blank with the manual.

questDatabase.name: Tier 1
questDatabase.description:
Congratulations we have the parts to start making a computer!

Let's start with the basics here.

questDatabase.name: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.
questDatabase.description: This block allows our computer to interact with GT machines and everything else.  A must have!

questDatabase.name: Hello World!
questDatabase.description:
First things first,  let's install OpenOS to the computer so you don't always need disk in the drive.  Type in 'install' and then type 'Y' when asked if you wish to install OpenOS.     
When finished, remove the disk and toss it on your wall and reboot the computer. 
Type 'df' to display all present file systems and mount points, you'll notice one named OpenOS; this is your hard drives default name after installing the OS.  
Let's change it with 'label set -a OpenOS HDD'   -a checks for names starting with what you type after it with that command.

Now for fun, let's make your first program!   How about something functional,  make a with 'edit startup'  this will bring you to an edit page for a new program called startup.      Let's just have it do something simple,  'print("Hello World!")'  Like that'll never get old.

Now press Ctrl+S to save, and Ctrl+W to get out of that screen.   Back in your home root let's now type startup and you'll see it display "Hello World!"  neat huh?

Let's now make startup actually work on startup.  Type 'edit .shrc' .shrc is a mystic file that runs shell commands when booting your PC.  So in .shrc type 'startup'   save and reboot the computer.  Now it should say "Hello World!" upon starting.   Double neat right?

questDatabase.name: I love pressing the F5 key.
questDatabase.description:
It's so refreshing.

Place a keyboard facing a screen- or stuck to the back of a screen to make it able to interact with a computer.
Absolutely necessary to doing anything on your computer, but can safely be removed once you have an endlessly running program.

questDatabase.name: Mounting your HDD
questDatabase.description:
Alright,  you have your computer, it says "Hello World!" When you start it, and you feel awesome and capable of world domination. 

Now lets setup your HDD.    Open .shrc again in the editor, and press ENTER to go down a line after the print, and type in 'cd ../'  this will move your viewed directory that's being viewed to-  well, the absolute base directory.  

Now go down another line and type in 'mount HDD C:'  because why not, it's Classic; this mounts the file drive into the folder you're in.   Go down another line and type cd 'C:/'   save and reboot the computer.

You'll now start in C:/  nifty!  Try typing 'mkdir programs' and now you have a dedicated directory to put your programs in for the sake of organization.
'cd programs' will then take you to programs, and 'cd ../' will take you back a directory; you can also do things like- lets say you have a folder called apples in C as well but you're in apples, type 'cd ../apples' and it'll take you to apples,  .. essentially just means previous directory and this can be stacked; works with copying files and moving them as well, very useful to know.  

ut right now we're going to do something functional,  come over to the next quest and bring your adapter and cables.

questDatabase.name: Basic Power Display
questDatabase.description:
For this part we will learn how to use our adapter,  place it next to- let's say your EBFs battery buffer and connect it to the computer with cables.
Now lets type in lua while on the computer to open the LUA environment where we can test things without worrying about saving and trying our program.

Type in 'component.list()'   this will display a table of all of .list from component.  What we're looking for is gt_batterybuffer.
If you have too many nearby things it may not display and the way to search the entire list of components is too advanced for starters.

So now assign a variable to it; for example 'a = component.gt_batterybuffer';  now we can call 'a' to see what methods the batteryBuffer has.
What we'll be using in this example is the 'getBatteryCharge' method.  So type
 'a.getBatteryCharge(1)' this will call the method getBatteryCharge from the first inventory slot on the gt_batterybuffer in component.

 So if we're using a 2x2 battery buffer; we can type something like- 'for i=1, 4 do print(a.getBatteryCharge(i)) end
Poof you now see what all the batteries EU values.  Now what can we do with this?

Try making a variable called 'batteryCharge = 0',  now do 'for i=1, 4 do batteryCharge = batteryCharge + a.getBatteryCharge(i) end'

Now print(batteryCharge) will display the total charge. Here's a program example of this being used.

Place in your tape drive and type 'install', and follow the promps to install it into C.  Then edit it, test it, figure how it works.

I suppose that's enough for now; congrats!  Experiment and learn, and don't forget to check google as much as possible!  
This questline will be updated again in the future; but I figure this is a good ending point for now.

questDatabase.name: Online Shopping - Tier 1
questDatabase.description: Hey, a use for bitcoins!

questDatabase.name: Purchase Network Card
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you a Network Card for six Bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Purchase Tier 1 Wireless Network Card
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you a Tier 1 Wireless Network Card for 12 Bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Purchase Tier 1 Memory
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you a pair of Tier 1 Memory Chips for four Bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Purchase Tier 1 Graphics Card
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you a Tier 1 Graphics Card for four Bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Purchase Tier 1 Graphics Card
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you a Tier 1 Graphics Card for four Bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Purchase Cables
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you 16 cables for two bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Purchase Tier 1 Screen
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you a Tier 1 Screen for three Bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Purchase Tier 1 Hard Drive
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you a Tier 1 Hard Drive for eight Bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Purchase Floppy Disk
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you a Floppy Disk for a Bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Purchase Keyboard
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you a Keyboard for two Bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Purchase Tier 1 Microchip
questDatabase.description: I'll sell you a Tier 1 Microchip for two Bitcoins.

questDatabase.name: Coin Conversion
questDatabase.description: Sell 32 of those Dogecoins for a Bitcoin.

questDatabase.name: Warp Warnings
questDatabase.description:
Thaumcraft offers considerable power from its devices and tools. 
But power comes with a price.... As of version 4.2, that price is represented by Warp: 
A corruption of the characters mind and soul, inflicting progressively more dire effects upon them. 
While the effects of warp can range from annoying to deadly, accumulating enough of it can also grant you access to greater power... at the cost of increasing madness, and attention from dark powers.
At least, others may call it madness... but is it truly insanity, when the voices in your head grant useful knowledge, and the monsters that appear before you leave remains behind?

Warp Theory add a bunch of new Warp Effects to the Player. Be very carful because you don't want autospawning an Wither in or bside you Base.
Warp Effects are Trickert by Warp Level.

Fake explosion warp effect can happen with 10 Warp
Fake creeper warp effect can happen with 10 Warp
Spawn bats can happen with 15 Warp
Poison warp effect can happen with 16 Warp
Jump boost warp effect can happen with 18 Warp
Rain warp effect can happen with 25 Warp
Blood warp effect can happen with 25 Warp
Nausea warp effect can happen with 25 Warp
Friendly creeper warp effect can happen with 26 Warp
Lightning warp effect can happen with 30 Warp
Livestock rain warp effect can happen with 32 Warp
Wind warp effect can happen with 38 Warp
Blindness warp effect can happen with 43 Warp
Random teleport can happen with 45 Warp
Acceleration warp effect can happen with 50 Warp
Decay warp effect can happen with 50 Warp
Random trees effect can happen with 50 Warp
Chest scramble warp effect can happen with 80 Warp
Spawn wither warp effect can happen with 80 Warp

questDatabase.name: Step Assistant.
questDatabase.description:
The Piston Boots are a bouncy pair of shoes for adventurers.

It functions as a piece of armor for the foot slot that gives a fun jump boost! They let the wearer jump up to THREE blocks in height and increase run speed. They also grant a Step Up enchantment to allow the wearer to step up a single block without jumping while sprinting.

questDatabase.name: Olives Saplings
questDatabase.description: Olive trees can't be find in the overworld so the best way would be to buy some with coins.

questDatabase.name: Traveller's Gear
questDatabase.description:
The goggles, wings, shoes, vest, belt and boots it self are not realy special. You can zoom with the googles, have a extra inventory slot with the belt, stepup assistent with the shoe, jump boost with the wings and faster swimming ability with the vest. You get protction like with normal armor too.
Later on you can upgrade your items to becomes more powerful ones.

questDatabase.name: Traveller's Goggles upgrades
questDatabase.description:
Nightvision is very usefull. If you combining your Goggles with a night vision potion, a golden carrot and a lighter inside the Tinkers Table you get Night Vison Goggles.

Hint:
Autorepair can be added to the goggles aswell.
Every Armor have 3 slots for modofication.

questDatabase.name: Traveller's Vest upgrades
questDatabase.description:
You vest can be equiped with a few modification like perfect doge and stealth.
Perfect doge mean you're harder to hit and can be stacked up to 3 times.
Stealth turn you invisible while sneaking.

Hint:
Autorepair can be added to the vest aswell.
Every Armor part have 3 Slots for modification.

questDatabase.name: Traveller's Wings upgrades
questDatabase.description:
Your wings can be equiped with a few modification feather falling and double jump.
Feather fall means allow you to glide down slowly in air.
Double Jump means you jump while in the air to jump again.

Hint:
Autorepair can be added to the wings aswell.
Every Armor part have 3 Slots for modification.

questDatabase.name: Traveller's Gloves upgrades
questDatabase.description:
Putting redstone on my weapon makes it faster. So why don't I put it on my hands directly!
It will be increases the mining speed.

Hint:
Every Armor part have 3 Slots for modification.
Gloves have 4.

questDatabase.name: Traveller's Shoes upgrades
questDatabase.description:
You shoes can be equiped with a few modification like water walk, double jump, lead boots or slimy shoes.
Water walk  mean to allows you to walk over water.
Double jump means to jump while in the air to jump again.
Lead Boots mean to allows you to walk under water, prevents you from swimming and Blub.
Slimy Shoes means to dampens the fall impact and reduces fall damage that you taken.

Hint:
Autorepair can be added to the shoes aswell.
Every Armor part have 3 Slots for modification.

questDatabase.name: Data Reader
questDatabase.description:
Assembly Line recipes are a pain in the A*****.
Scanning the item, printing it and make a book from it is a long process and the book recipe contains only text.
Why not using the Data reader from Tec Tech?
It shows up the recipe in Nei.

questDatabase.name: Unlocking bee breeding lines
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Factory Iron Door
questDatabase.description:
For your new Factory you need iron doors. Well the recipe is realy hard and need steel. 
You can choose two more doors as reward if you like.

questDatabase.name: Wooden Door
questDatabase.description:
For your new House you need more wooden  doors. Well the recipe is realy hard and need iron/copper and a lot of wood. 
You can choose two more doors as reward if you like.

questDatabase.name: Oilsand or how you get heavy Oil
questDatabase.description:
Oilsand is an other way to get oil, heavy oil. Maybe you lucky and found in a dessert biome a oilsand vein. With your centrifuge ou are able to get heavy oil and sand blocks out of the ore.
The veins can be found between Y level 50-80.

questDatabase.name: I guess it is an inkjet?
questDatabase.description:
When you use the seismic prospector, you'll need a scanner and a printer to create the books full of tasty ores and delicious fluids.

Use ink sacs in a fluid extractor to get squid ink. Move using a tank or universal cells.

questDatabase.name: Better dirt
questDatabase.description: With an Assembler and some seedoil, you can turn dirt and sand into Garden Soil.  This optimal soil does not require water nearby and crops do not break when you fall on it.  It can turn into dirt if you run on it, so be careful. You might want to investigate the Slow Building Ring in Building Better Bases.

questDatabase.name: Even more stats
questDatabase.description: With the portable scanner, you can get the crop's stats and environmental info while it is still in the ground.  Look for the portable scanner quest after the EBF in Multiblock Goals.

questDatabase.name: Metals from the Sky
questDatabase.description: You can even create metals not found on Earth using crops!  You'll need the proper metal block beneath the crop in order for them to fully mature.

questDatabase.name: Better Gallium and Arsenic sources
questDatabase.description:
There are a couple of ways to increase your Gallium.

1. Use IC2 crops under the Farming tab to get Galvania leaves, to 4x your zinc and sphalerite crushed ores to purified ores.

2. Use the HV macerator on the centrifuged ores to get a 10 percent chance of a whole Gallium dust.

3. Use plentiful Bauxite ores from the Moon.

For Arsenic, Cobaltite ore in the Twilight Forest is a great source. It can be multiplied 4x by the IC2 crop Nickelback.

questDatabase.name: New threads
questDatabase.description:
Tired of killing spiders for string? Grow some flax for an easy non-biting source of string.

You can also directly place Cotton seeds on cropsticks to grow cotton that way. With some Corium in the next quest, you can get easy tanned leather.

questDatabase.name: The ground is crying
Blazes too hard to kill?
questDatabase.description:
Then grow some blazereed to save yourself the trouble.

Tearstalks should easily yield blazereed.

questDatabase.name: A girl's best friend
questDatabase.description: Need to impress a lady?  How about growing diamonds on reeds?!?

questDatabase.name: Why does my plant bawk like a chicken?
questDatabase.description: Because it can lay eggs!

questDatabase.name: Vegan, but still want to eat meat?
questDatabase.description: Instead of killing animals, just mutate some crazy GMOs into making animal products for you. Science!

questDatabase.name: Magical Metal Berry
questDatabase.description: ..is obviously the name of my cover band. But also a great crop for Thaumium or Void metals. Requires a block of iron or thaumium to get thaumium, and void metal block to get void metal.  Like other ore berries, it only grows in dim light. Any oreberry should have a decent chance of yielding this.

questDatabase.name: Other magic flowers
questDatabase.description: Other magical flowers are possible such as shimmerleaf, mandragora, wolf's bane, and more.

questDatabase.name: Stonelillies
questDatabase.description:
Stone lillies allow you to get dusts without having to look for granites, basalt, or marble.  Great renewable way to get calcite, fluorine, or bulk aluminium (and a tiny bit of uranium).

These require the original block directly beneath them to grow properly.

There is also a Grey stonelilly for stone dust (who needs more of that??) and a Yellow stonelilly for sand or Endstone dust. Handy for the clever chemist!

questDatabase.name: Glowstone
questDatabase.description: There are a couple of different glowstone crops - glowflower, glowing earth coral, and glowshrooms. Nether wart is a great source of these.

questDatabase.name: Leaves of steel
questDatabase.description: Well, steel leaves anyways.  Instead of grinding Twilight Forest for steel leaves, grow a crop in peace.

questDatabase.name: Plants that make their own fertilizer?
questDatabase.description:
Sign me up! This plant will create fertilzer ingredients for you. 

Decent plants to cross to get Fertilia are spidernip, venomilia, or zomplant. Watch out for venomilia though, not only is it poisonous, it also promotes weed growth!

You can make Forestry fertilizer with the drops from this plant in a mixer.

questDatabase.name: Renewable oil
questDatabase.description: Oil from crops?  Makes as much sense as oil from bees!

questDatabase.name: Boost your speed v 2
questDatabase.description: High speed transition and booster tracks get your carts moving at really ridiculous speeds.  Do not use normal track without several transition tracks or else your cart will explode.  Do not try turning at high speed or, you guessed it, your cart will explode.

questDatabase.name: Even LARGER tanks
questDatabase.description: 4000 buckets not enough storage? Stockpiling diesel for a lifetime? Try a Super Tank 2.

questDatabase.name: Teflon Don
questDatabase.description:
To make PTFE, aka Teflon, you only need a few steps.  

The first one is hydrofluoric acid.  If you have not reached the moon yet, the best sources for fluorine are hammering sandstone for a chance at fluorite and centrifuging stone dust or black granite dust for biotite. You can also get small amounts from Lepidolite in salt veins and Mica. Mix it with some hydrogen to get hydrofluoric acid.

questDatabase.name: Chloroform
questDatabase.description:
The next step is to mix methane and chlorine to make chloroform.  Make sure you have your circuit set correctly.

Now is probably a good time to look at stockpiling chlorine.  Look for salt ores, or lapis veins. You can also make salt water with ghast tears.  Better get started with IC2 crops, you will need a lot of chlorine later!

questDatabase.name: Tetrafluoroethylene
questDatabase.description: Liquid hot plastics smell great, don't they? Mix your hydrofluoric acid and chloroform to make tetrafluoroethylene. React the TFE with oxygen to make molten PTFE. Finally a fluid solidifer will make bars for you.

questDatabase.name: How much is too much fluid?
questDatabase.description: There is no limit to how much fluid you might want to store. Make yourself some super tank III's for all your bulk storage needs.

questDatabase.name: Calcite getting you down?
questDatabase.description: Having a hard time finding that Lapis vein for some calcite? I'll trade you some for your hard earned coins and some stone.

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #7: Upgrade tier 8 - Electrum Flux Coils
questDatabase.description: To process the more advanced materials like Cosmic Neutronium, Tritanium and Awakened Draconium you need more than 9000K. Upgrade your EBF to 9900k.

questDatabase.name: Large Essentia Generator
questDatabase.description: Having one Essentia Generator per Essentoia type seeems unpracticable.... Better make a Large Essentia Generator and burn all this Essentia in parallel! As another Bonus, this Generator produces 20x the Energy a Single Block Machine will produce. You might need more Magic Containment Casings than this Quest asks for.

questDatabase.name: Circuit Programmer
questDatabase.description: The Circuit Programmer is a useful tool that will enable you to program integrated circuits without having to deal with 24 different crafting recipes. Just charge it, put the Integrated Circuit in it and click on the Number you want it to be programmed to.

questDatabase.name: Lapotronic Energy Storage Unit
questDatabase.description: The L.E.S.U. is one of the oldest Machines that are aviable in Gregtech, its origins are in Minecraft 1.3.X, now its redone to fit into this Modpack. You can add a nearly infinite number of LESU casings to it and you'll have a hughe Energy Storage. You might also live inside your Battery.

questDatabase.name: Cable Diodes
questDatabase.description: Sometimes you just need a Diode, either to prevent reflow in your complex Energy System or on Thermos Server's Chunk borders. Make one 4A Diode and get a 2A one for free!

questDatabase.name: Manual Transformer
questDatabase.description: Annoyed by building Chains of transformers? Dont want an Explosion Risk at your base? Want to use these fancy 64A Hatches and Dynamos from TecTech to convert your power? Make a Manual Dynamo and convert it all!

questDatabase.name: Mobile Trash Can
questDatabase.description: GT2's Destructorpack is a mobile Trashcan. Might be handy!

questDatabase.name: Rock Cutter LV
questDatabase.description: The Rock Cutter is an unbreakable and Silk-touched Mining Device. It will enable you to mine blocks without damaging them, like glass or stone, while it is charged.

questDatabase.name: L.E.S.U. Upgrade - LV Tier
questDatabase.description: Adding this much Cells anywhere to your LESU will upgrade it from ULV to LV.

questDatabase.name: L.E.S.U. Upgrade - MV Tier
questDatabase.description: Adding an additional ammount of Cells will not only cause your storage capacity to rise, but also will enable MV Voltage.

questDatabase.name: L.E.S.U. Upgrade - HV Tier
questDatabase.description: The HV Tier upgrade first needs over a Stack of Casings. More Casings, more Energy, more Capacity.

questDatabase.name: L.E.S.U. Upgrade - EV Tier
questDatabase.description: Close to 8 Stacks of LESU Casings, this upgrade enables EV Voltage on your LESU. It's easy until now.

questDatabase.name: L.E.S.U. Upgrade - IV Tier
questDatabase.description: 24 Stacks of LESU Casings. These do fit in your Inventory, but crafting them is another problem.

questDatabase.name: L.E.S.U. Upgrade - LuV Tier
questDatabase.description: To reach the highest Voltage Tier the LESU can offer, you need to add an additional amount of LESU Casings. 8193 Casings in total (all upgrades below and these additional) enable the LuV Input Voltage. To submit these you'll need to use the Submit Station from the Steam Tab, since your inventory isnt big enough to hold 96 Stacks.

questDatabase.name: Circle Shapes give me comfort
questDatabase.description:
To build a Windmill you will need a Dispenser, but that item is locked behind the next Tier. Go and find one in a Witchery Circle. They look like small versions of Stonehenge.

Look for the main quest in Multiblock Goals.

questDatabase.name: Grinding with Wind
questDatabase.description:
The Windmill is a grinder that uses the force of wind to macerate Items and Blocks. It is pretty slow and won't macerate ores well. You will only get one crushed Ore from it. However it does give you a bonus when you try to macerate other things. That bonus depends on the Item inserted, for example Netherrack has a chance to give two instead of one dust and Wheat will always give one and a quarter flour.

The dispensers replace a clay block in the walls. Put anything you like in the interior - a bed, stairs, torches, etc.

Normal multiblock rules apply - do not cross chunk boundaries with this multiblock.

If this is your first Gregtech multiblock, as with all the rest you will need to whack the controller with a softhammer to activate it.

If you have troubles forming the multiblock, try breaking and replacing the controller block.

The controller can be fed items via hoppers etc to allow for larger batches. Just don't allow the dispenser to fill up or it will void outputs.

The rotor blades will run if the controller is disabled or has no recipe. Remove the blades when not in use or else they'll be used up.

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #8: Upgrade tier 9 - Awakened Draconium Coils
questDatabase.description: To process the most advanced materials like Infinity Catalys or Infinity need more than 9900K. Upgrade your EBF to 10800k.

questDatabase.name: Mushroom Biomes ? why there so many?
questDatabase.description:
GNTH pack is made for the rwg worldgen. If you run the vanilla biomes worlgen you get huge Mushroom biomes over the map. Go and generate a new world before you continue this one. If you run a server put this inside your server.properties file.

 "level-type=rwg".

questDatabase.name: Tantalum
questDatabase.description:
Tantalum is used in the GT and Ender IO Capacitors and also a source for niobium. It is a cheap essentia source for Thaumcraft later on.
You will find Tantalite Mix at Y 20-30 on the Overworld.

questDatabase.name: Kitchenware 2.0
questDatabase.description:
Gregtech tools like the knives get used up when crafting foods. Pams Tool like the Cutting Board, Juicer or the Bakeware can last forever.
 
After you reach stainless steel in HV you can make these forever tools.

questDatabase.name: Ardite and Cobalt Mining
questDatabase.description: Ironwood is much harder and durable material than you imagined at first. Making Tools and Armor give them very unique features. With a Pick you can mine at cobalt Level which means you can harvest ardite and cobalt without a EBF.

questDatabase.name: Low on Sticks?
questDatabase.description: If you stay in the Twilight Forest you will find the Canopy Tree. This big tree generates a lot of logs for your Coke ovens and some roots when planted which give sticks. Be careful that no building or chest right beside or above the Tree otherwise the Tree replaces it. You might find a use for this, to sinfully get above a ceiling you really shouldn't.

questDatabase.name: "Oh magic" armor
questDatabase.description: Ironwood Armor is a magic armor with some special enchants. The Helm gives aqua afinity, the shoes feather falling, the plate and the legs extra protection.

questDatabase.name: Spice up with some salt
questDatabase.description: You will need massive quantities of chlorine for future plastics. There are underground salt water deposits on the Moon, Mars, and Europa. Use a seismic prospector to locate one and build the Underground Fluid Drill from multiblock goals to extract.

questDatabase.name: Moron's Manual for Massacring Monsters
questDatabase.description:
If you have not noticed, this world is a true hellscape full of Special Mobs and Infernals around every corner. Unlike vanilla, a player has to actually stay aware and pay attention to what they are fighting. Here are some tips.

If an infernal has Vengeance, don't shoot it with your 56 damage crossbow!

A high health infernal with regeneration is hard to kill. Even worse if it is a witch that can also heal itself. In those cases, run like hell, or bring a soul vial to capture it and throw it into Mount Doom. 

Watch out for zombies with fishing poles - they can pull you into them. And zombies with a bow and arrow - they can shoot you back!

questDatabase.name: Creeping dread
questDatabase.description:
Creepers can cause the worst problems. 

Drowning Creeper - when it explodes, it surrounds you in a ball of cobble filled with water. Not only do you have to escape, but the cobble is infested with silverfish! And those silverfish are all infernal as well.  The best way to deal with it is to first escape up or down.  If you have to clear the cobble ball, first clear the water. Surrounding the cobble with a dirt moat will keep the silverfish inside and unable to hide. Put down punjis, quicksand, or lava, and/or spectral glass. Make a wall with a 1x1 window and use that to break the cobbles - fishing silverfish are especially dangerous.

Ender Creeper - Randomly teleports you a short distance - possibly deep underground.

questDatabase.name: Caught in the web
questDatabase.description:
Spiders to watch for...

Witch spiders reflect missile damage back at you. Look for the red X on their back, and draw your melee weapon and prepare for close combat.

Mother spiders will spawn a lot of baby spiders, some of which may be infernal.

A flying spider can grab the oblivious flyer.

Ghost spiders are partially invisible and can pass through thin walls.

questDatabase.name: Porkchops with attitude
questDatabase.description: The only zombie pigman to watch out for is the Vampire Pigman.  He hardly takes any damage unless you use a wooden sword as a stake or have a magical sword.
