questDatabase.description: While the SAG mill will work with no grinding heads, flint heads only save a little power.  If you want to exploit the true capability of the SAG mill, you want to use Diamond or Tungsten grinding heads.  Craft me a Diamond and I'll give you a Tungsten as a reward.

questDatabase.name: Key to your heart
questDatabase.description: Barrels by default allow locking the barrel to a specific item, even when empty.  For drawers however you will need to make the Drawer Key to lock its content types.

questDatabase.name: Incubator
questDatabase.description:
This is a crafting machine that heats items and liquids to a temperature that encourages bacterial growth. 

The first step of incubation is the creation of Liquid Growth Medium, which is made from incubating Water and Growth Medium. This is subsequently incubated with Wheat to give Bacteria. This solution of bacteria can then be incubated a third time with Sugar to give Enzyme. This is an important compound used in other machines.

The best way to create enzyme is therefore to chain three incubators together, for each step of the process.

questDatabase.name: Bees by the millions
questDatabase.description: If you need endgame high speed bee production, industrial apiaries are the path to follow. Industrial Apiaries take upgrade frames that never break. Production frames can be stacked up to 8 high. It also has many options for emulation, more pollen retrieval, and others.

questDatabase.name: Fastest way to get there
questDatabase.description: A GT++ Mutagenic frame will get your bees to their final destination faster than you can blink. Just remember to wear your rubber suit while making it!

questDatabase.name: Upgrading the Alveary (tier 1)
questDatabase.description:
These basic upgrades to the Alveary make it more powerful. 

Frame housing - Automation-enabled frames for the Alveary
Swarmer - Creates additional Ignoble queens in hives around the Alveary
Hygroregulator - Controls for humidity, and to a lesser extent temperature. Will require lava or water.
Stabilizer - Prevents the princess or queen from changing species. Ideal for breeding traits into a line.
Sieve - Instead of the pollen from a bee fertilizing a nearby tree, it is stored here and can be manually applied. Requires manually placing woven silk in the inventory.
Rain shield - Keeps bees that are not rain tolerant dry and working.
Hatchery - Hatches larval bees for use in Genetics or to create additional drones.

questDatabase.name: Busy Bees Buzzing Boldly
questDatabase.description:
These upgrades can significantly increase your production rate by keeping your bees from stopping production.
Transmission - Provides power to frame blocks that need it throughout the alveary.
Alveary Fan - Cools your temperature a large amount.
Alveary Heater - Warms your temperature a large amount.
Lighting - Provides light for bees that do not work at night.

questDatabase.name: A stim a day keeps the doctor awake
questDatabase.description:
Supporting circuit boards that can hold 4 electron tubes, the Electrical Stimulator provides a variety of functions. All numbers are in percent

LV - Prod: 150 (Max 500) - Iron ET
HV - Prod: 250 (Max 1000) - Diamantine ET
Biotic - Poll: 150 (Max 500) - Apatine ET
Charged - Life: 80 (Min 20) - Obsidian ET
Gentle - Life: 150 (Max 500) - Lapis ET
Molten - Simulates the Nether - Blazing ET
Mutagenic - Muta: 150 (Max 500) - Golden ET
Inhibiting - Terr: 40 (Min 10) Prod: 90 (Min 50) - Tin ET
Agitating - Terr: 150 (Max 500) - Bronze ET

questDatabase.name: X-Men, or should I say X-Bee?
questDatabase.description:
The Mutator can vastly accelerate genetic mutations, even allowing those ultra rare bees to be bred. Items inserted into the Mutator control how much mutation it causes.

Soul Sand - 50 percent increase
Ender Pearl - 100 percent increase
Eye of Ender - 300 percent increase
Nether star - 1000 percent increase

questDatabase.name: Genepool
questDatabase.description: Another important resource is Raw DNA. This can be obtained from any breedable organism such as bees, trees or flowers, and is created in the Genepool. The Genepool requires both Ethanol and Enzyme to digest the DNA, and will destroy the organism. Note this gives raw DNA, and does not preserve any genes or alleles present.

questDatabase.name: Isolator
questDatabase.description: The Isolator acts in a similar way to the Genepool, but does not completely destroy genes. It instead allows the isolation of a single gene from an organism, without destroying it. The exact gene is random, and is written into an Blank Sequence. Until the sequence is analysed in an Analyser, it will be unknown what the gene is. It doesn't however need to be analysed before being sent to the Sequencer.

questDatabase.name: Sequencer
questDatabase.description:
After obtaining a DNA Sequence with the gene that you wish, it must be placed in the Sequencer. This uses Fluorescent Dye to determine the correct sequence, and when completed logs the discovery. The important thing here is that the discovery goes to the person who placed the machine.

Genes are sequenced faster if the sequence has been placed in a Polymeriser first to increase the strength.

questDatabase.name: Polymeriser
questDatabase.description: Serums and sequences can be placed in a Polymeriser to increase their strength and amount of DNA held within. Serums need to be polymerised at least once before being used in the inoculator. To polymerise, both Raw DNA and Polymerising Bacteria are required. Raw DNA is obtained from the Genepool, and Polymerising Bacteria is made from incubating bacteria with bonemeal. Gold nuggets can be used as a catalyst to speed up the process.

questDatabase.name: Gene Database
questDatabase.description: Discovered genes are logged into the Gene Database. This handheld device lists all genes by the type of organism they apply to. To add a gene to an Empty Serum Vial to allow inoculation, the desired gene can be clicked on while holding the vial. An Empty Serum Array can be used to hold more than one gene at once.

questDatabase.name: Lab Stand
questDatabase.description: The Lab Stand is a block on which an Apiarist Database, Arborist Database, Botanist Database or Gene Database can be placed by right clicking on the placed stand with the database, attaching it and allowing the database to be accessed by right clicking on the stand.

questDatabase.name: Combined analyzers
questDatabase.description: Tired of carrying around seperate bee, tree, and butterfly analyzers? This combined tool will do all 3.

questDatabase.name: Registry
questDatabase.description: The Registry combines the existing four databases into a new sleek browser to allow the properties, mutations and genes of all discovered bees, trees, butterflies and flowers.

questDatabase.name: Inoculator
questDatabase.description:
The final step is inoculation. Currently the only machine capable of inserting genes is the Inoculator. This uses Bacteria Vector, created by incubating Bacteria and Blaze Powder, to transfer the gene into organisms.

Only the young stage of organisms can be injected, which are larvae (bees), pollen (trees and flowers) and caterpillars (butterflies). Bee larvae can be converted into drones by incubating with Liquid Growth Medium.

questDatabase.name: Tools for the Geneticist
questDatabase.description: You'll need various tools and supplies before you start manipulating genetic material.

questDatabase.name: Keeping track of your findings (Botany)
questDatabase.description: This handy device will keep track of the flowers you have discovered so far, and their properties.

questDatabase.name: Figuring out Butterflies
questDatabase.description: Butterflies don't do much, but this analyzer will give you details on their abilties.

questDatabase.name: Keeping track of trees
questDatabase.description: This device will keep track of all the trees you have discovered.

questDatabase.name: Bee more knowledgeable
questDatabase.description: This database keeps track of everything bee.

questDatabase.name: Fluttering Facts
questDatabase.description: This database tracks all your knowledge of butterflies.

questDatabase.name: Speeding up slow machines
questDatabase.description: Many mods don't have methods of speeding up their slow machines. For this, you'll need a GregTech World Accelerator. It guzzles amps though so your power infrastructure better be ready for it. The tooltip will list the performance boost provided. For block-based acceleration, the WA will do an area around it. For TileEntities like most machines, it will only accelerate the blocks directly touching the WA, and will need to be reconfigured with a screwdriver.

questDatabase.name: Hail to the King
questDatabase.description: If you get lucky, you might find a King Slime in your travels. Kill it and I'll give you a really nice replacement head for one of your tools.

questDatabase.name: Sometimes life is scary and dark - Bring a backpack
questDatabase.description:
Now that you are MV, you can make an Adventure Backpack. This very useful backpack can do many things. It can store 2 tools for quick access, has internal tanks for containing liquids - use the Hose to access them, a built in crafting table, and storage. When placed on your back, it can be accessed using a quick-access key, default is B. Check your controls for details. 
When placed on the ground, it can be accessed with a right-click. While on the ground, the bedroll can be deployed and used. 
They can also be upgraded to add special abilities. For more special abilities than those featured here, check the Adventure Backpacks wiki.

questDatabase.name: See like a ... bat?
questDatabase.description: Nightvision is a great backpack ability.

questDatabase.name: Swim like a .... squid?
questDatabase.description: If you need to go deep or explore in the water, this is the backpack for you.

questDatabase.name: Walk through fire
questDatabase.description: The Pigman backpack will make the Nether ezpz with fire resistance. You'll have to figure out a way to get struck by lightning while wearing a Pig backpack to get it...

questDatabase.name: Creeper Repellant
questDatabase.description: An ocelot backpack will get those creepers running away from you. Nice protection against those drowning creepers! Don't get too close to them or else their repulsion will be overriden and they will blow up!

questDatabase.name: Milk without the cow?
questDatabase.description: A Cow backpack will generate milk from wheat placed in its inventory. Great for a lazy farmer!

questDatabase.name: Here be dragons
questDatabase.description: The Dragon backpack gives you Fire Resistance, Strength, Water Breathing, Night Vision and Regeneration.

questDatabase.name: Smart cables
questDatabase.description: Smart cables are better than glass or covered cables because you can visually see many channels are in use.

questDatabase.name: Dense cables
questDatabase.description: Dense cables are going to be your network backbones. They can transfer 32 channels and display the number of channels in use. Busses and flat interfaces cannot be placed directly on them.

questDatabase.name: Better Grafter through Technology
questDatabase.description: The GT Branch Cutter is much better than the forestry grafters.  It can have much higher durability based upon which material you use to create it.

questDatabase.name: Speak for the trees
questDatabase.description:
You'll need to find a bunch of vanilla trees to start your breeding program. To convert them directly to Forestry trees, you can use a Treealyzer - but you'll need a carpenter and aluminium from MV for that. Alternatively, you can just grow a bunch of vanilla trees and surround them by good pollination bees in bee housing. Spectacles will help you see the fertilized leaves to harvest with your Grafter or Branch Cutter.

Completing the quests will require scanned trees, but you can progress on breeding while waiting for your GT Scanner or Treealyzer to be made.

questDatabase.name: Unlocking tree breeding lines
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Silver Lime
questDatabase.description: Silver Lime, a basic tree breed. Breed it by mating Silver Birch with Apple Oak.

questDatabase.name: Teak
questDatabase.description: Teak is the first step to Cocobolo, a true giant. Breed it by mating Jungle and Dark Oak.

questDatabase.name: Balsa
questDatabase.description: Balsa has some pretty wood. Breed it by mating Teak and Acacia.

questDatabase.name: Common Beech
questDatabase.description: Common Beech gives you access to the Faster maturity attribute. Breed them from Silver Birch and Apple Oak.

questDatabase.name: Hill Cherry
questDatabase.description: Hill Cherry is a key tree for breeding purposes. Breed it by mating Silver Lime with Apple Oak.

questDatabase.name: Common Walnut
questDatabase.description: The Common Walnut is a mediocre choice for a seedoil tree, only producing 54L per nut. Breed it by mating Hill Cherry with Silver Lime.

questDatabase.name: Butternut
questDatabase.description:
The Butternut tree is a pretty good seedoil producer at 180L per nut. Breed it by mating Hill Cherry with Common Walnut.

It's attributes aren't that great, but with a little crossbreeding you can get that 2x2 giant with fast production. For optimal fruit production speed, try breeding Fruity bees.

questDatabase.name: Lemon
questDatabase.description: Lemon trees are great for maximum fruit juice production. Breed it by mating Hill Cherry with Silver Lime.

questDatabase.name: Plum
questDatabase.description: The Plum is a great multipurpose tree.  It has optimal yield and its fruit produces mulch with the highest chance. It also has decent sappiness for biomass production. Breed it by mating Hill Cherry with Lemon.

questDatabase.name: Desert Acacia
questDatabase.description: Desert Acacia. Another step on the road. Breed it by mating Teak with Balsa.

questDatabase.name: Cocobolo
questDatabase.description: The Cocobolo is a nice tall tree, perfect for mating into your Plum or Butternut to maximize their yield. Breed it by mating Desert Acacia with Dark Oak.

questDatabase.name: Blue Mahoe
questDatabase.description: The Blue Mahoe has the most sappiness of any tree.  It will vastly increase the efficiency of your biomass production with Fermenters. Breed it by mating Balsa with Desert Acacia.

questDatabase.name: Energy Acceptor
questDatabase.description:
The Energy Acceptor is an alternative place to inject energy into your AE2 network. Generally, you want to inject energy at the controller because if it cannot see an EA within the first 8 parts, the network will not form anyways.

You can form a "dumb" network with just an EA, but for real capability, you'll want a Controller.

questDatabase.name: ME Controller
questDatabase.description: The heart of your ME network. Inject energy into here as well to power your network.

questDatabase.name: Making Sense of Spaghetti
questDatabase.description: Nobody likes an untidy base. You can craft a spray can and fill it with Chemical Dye made from sulfuric acid to color coordinate your carpets, cables, wires, and machines.

questDatabase.name: Oink!
questDatabase.description: While the Pig backpack is useless on its own, it can be turned into a pretty powerful tool with the right...motivation.

questDatabase.name: A Fool Fit for a King
questDatabase.description: Only the craziest fool would use diamonds to make a tool! Or is it crazy like a fox?

questDatabase.name: Welcome to the Church of Benzene
questDatabase.description:
If you made it to MV using steam, you're probably wondering how to survive going further. One option is to switch to Light Fuel, discussed in LV.  Another option is to use Benzene. Benzene is made from Wood Tar. There are a couple of pathways for that. Both start with logs from trees.  

One path is to use Coke ovens or Advanced Coke Ovens to make charcoal, and fluid-extract Wood Tar from it (use LV fluid extractors for maximum EU efficiency). Then distill the Wood Tar to make Benzene. This method produces no pollution.

The second path is to use the Pyrolyze Oven multiblock and Nitrogen gas to extract Wood Tar and Charcoal. Fluid Extract the Charcoal for addtional Wood Tar.  Then proceed as above. This method will create pollution from the Pyrolyze, but will provide more Benzene per log.

Excess wood tar can also be turned into Toluene, a key ingredient for explosives that you will need later on.

questDatabase.name: Automated Crafting
questDatabase.description: The Auto Workbench is a simple automated crafting system.  You select the recipe in the grid, and place components in the inventory. They will slowly be converted into the crafted item. While not fast, it does support automation - only items acceptable to the recipe is allowed in the inventory.

questDatabase.name: Choices, choices
questDatabase.description:
Need a map on fuel choices? Well, we don't have that but we have suggestions. You can run Steam from burning up to EV, but beyond MV it gets pretty painful. 

In LV you can start refining oil for either Light Fuel or Refinery Gas, which will be good for you to EV. 

Once you hit MV you can switch from Steam to renewable Benzene from your logs if you decided to hold out. Other renewable alternatives are Fishoil or Seedoil based Biodiesel. Seedoil can be sourced from Pam's peanuts, IC2 Rape crop or Forestry tree nuts.

Also at MV you can upgrade your Light Fuel with Heavy Fuel to get Diesel.

When you reach HV turn Diesel or Biodiesel into Cetane Boosted Diesel.

After reaching the Moon, Wind and Water Kinetics are available.

EV introduces the Large Gas Turbine and Large Combustion Engine, along with granting access to Nukes.

For low usage operations, or dedicated players willing to setup automation systems, you can begin using Solar Panels at MV.

questDatabase.name: Don't put a finger in that socket
questDatabase.description: If you want to pass multiple amps through your cleanroom walls, use a one-way Diode.  Also handy to limit power when branching off a main power line to trunk lines that normally will not use as many amps, but you want to prevent catching fire while filling buffers.

questDatabase.name: E_TOO_MANY_KEYS
questDatabase.description:
ERROR: Too many keys to fit a 104 key keyboard. You will need to redefine your keymap so that you can use things effectively.  Here is a list of keys you should deconflict.

Adventure Backpacks
B - Inventory
V - Toggle
Backpacks
G - Open Backpack (sneak-G to wear/remove backpack and set filtering)
Dark Steel Armor
Apostrophe - Night Vision
Gameplay
R - Draw Weapons
Z - Special (cycle arrows on M&B quiver)
NONE - Drop Item (Who wants to throw a backpack into lava?)
IC2
C - Side Invetory Key
Journeymap
Home - Make Waypoint
J - Open Map
= - Zoom In (works on minimap too)
- - Zoom Out (same)
Misc
H - Toggle Hover Harness
F - Toggle Wand Focus
TC Node Tracker
I - Node List (must be scanned, goggles allow compass)
X - Zoom key (handy for checking on distant ores on a mountain)
Tinker's Construct
Delete - Traveller's Belt Swap Hotbar

questDatabase.name: BRRRRAAAAAAAIIIIIIINNNNNNNSSSSS
questDatabase.description: Automagy is a little subtle about what the "smort" mage needs to do next. Make some crystalline brains and scan them to unlock the next stage. You'll want to use the zombie brains you've been collecting from dangerous Furious zombies found at Eerie nodes.

questDatabase.name: Gimme gimme gimme
questDatabase.description: The Avarice Pearl is the next object Automagy requires you to interact with in order to unlock the next section. Make an Avarice Pearl , throw some stuff on the ground, and throw Avarice Pearls at them by right-clicking quickly over and over to get a Shathered (ha ha) Pearl to unlock a few more research items.

questDatabase.name: Engraved Lapotrons
questDatabase.description:
IV tier batteries require a large investment.  First, you will need to laser engrave 8 Lapotrons. Make sure to do this in a cleanroom.

They're also used for some advanced AE2 chips.

questDatabase.name: Lapotronic Energy Orb
questDatabase.description: The Lapotronic Energy Orb is the IV tier battery item. It can store 100M EU. Don't charge it until you have verified it for the quest.

questDatabase.name: One BILLION EU
questDatabase.description:
If you want a stationary battery, you can make an AFSU capable of storing up to 1 billion EU and charging items. You can pick it up with a wrench, but you'll lose a percentage of the stored EU. Make sure you right-click, not left-click.  Left-clicking will cause it to lose all stored EU.

As an alternative, if you can afford them, try the GT++ Energy Buffers. They are more expensive and cannot charge items, but store more, don't lose any EU, and can be configured from 1-16A. See the GT++ tab for details.

questDatabase.name: Can't spell Lignite without Ignite
questDatabase.description: Truly the fuel of the gods!

questDatabase.name: Who would use this garbage??
questDatabase.description: Truly the fuel of idiots!

questDatabase.name: Fruity bees
questDatabase.description: Fruity bees will make your Forestry trees ripen their fruit faster. Breed them using a Sweetened and Thriving.

questDatabase.name: Sweetened
questDatabase.description: Sweetened bees can make you sugar. Breed them from Valiant and Diligent.

questDatabase.name: Thriving
questDatabase.description: Thriving bees don't have an effect, but are a necessary step for Fruity. Breed them from Growing and Unweary.

questDatabase.name: Diligent
questDatabase.description: Diligent bees are a core breeding stock bee. Breed them from Common and Cultivated.

questDatabase.name: Unweary
questDatabase.description: Unweary bees are key to a couple of breeding lines. Breed them with Diligent and Cultivated.

questDatabase.name: Growing
questDatabase.description: Growing bees are the start of the Fruity specific breeding tree.  Breed them from Forest and Diligent.

questDatabase.name: Bees Template - change to OR when copying, back to AND to hide
questDatabase.description:
Get the princess bee and reward bag in NEI first. 
Do Advanced and set the icon to the bee.
Do Task, and select the stone, and replace it with the princess.
Before closing, select the ... next to the bee name and press Raw NBT
Go into Tag, Genome, Chromosomes. The first one is the name and must stay. 
Go inside there and delete the first entry, keep both of the species so players
must have purebreeds.
Delete the rest of the chromosomes.
Delete the rest of the entries for Genome.
Remove the Infinity unlock requirement.

questDatabase.name: Carpenter's Blocks
questDatabase.description:
Yet another custom block system! Carpenter's blocks are crafted blank and placed in-world, and then plain block textures applied to them. The blocks must not be Tile Entities, so Botany blocks don't work correctly with them, but GT Stones like Red Granite, and any colored clay or vanilla glass block will work. Some Chisel glass types will work, and Ztones blocks and Tinted Glass also work.

The Garage Door requires a block at the top to hang "down" from, but can pretty much be any length.  A redstone signal on any block next to the Garage Door blocks will open or close the door. The open/close will propagate across multiple vertical doors, so you can setup non-square doors. Sneaking and right-clicking with an empty hand will change the door's polarity.

The pressure plates are player-only activation, making them great for doors into your base.

The hatches must be clicked on the side of a block to place. They can be handy for protecting you from crucible...byproducts.
 
There is a lot more block shapes possible, check NEI for "Carpenter's" to see the options.

The Chisel allows you to chisel blocks while attached to a Carpenter's block.

The Hammer allows various functions.

Hammer on door - changes door shape type
Sneak Hammer on door - Changes from iron to wooden behavior
Sneak Hammer on lever - Changes polarity (which direction is on/off)

questDatabase.name: Safety first
questDatabase.description:
For those new to GregTech, here are some tips and warnings about electricity. 

Machines don't like being out in the rain, and will start fires nearby.  Fires next to a machine have a random chance of an explosion. Also, sending too high voltage to a machine will cause a near-instant explosion.

Sending too high a voltage or too many amps down a cable will cause the cable to burn up and start fires, which may then cause machine explosions. Make sure the number of amps provided by generators and buffers to a wire does not exceed the amps it is capable of carrying.

A generator that supplys 1A can possibly feed multiple machines, if their recipes require less than full voltage.  For example, macerators doing ore only need 2 EU/t, so you could run 4 or 5 off of a single 1A generator, as long as the wires aren't too long. But be careful! Sometimes a recipe needs a lot more EU than you expect, like a macerator sand -> quartz dust recipe.

A single block machine starved of EU will restart progress but not lose the recipe items. A multiblock machine will lose the items.

questDatabase.name: Copper
questDatabase.description: The Copper bee is the first of the metal lines. There are too many metal breeding lines to cover here, but by now you should be able to use NEI to figure out how to breed more bee types. Copper bees require a copper block beneath the bee housing. Breed them from Majestic and Clay.

questDatabase.name: Clay bee
questDatabase.description: To breed a Clay bee you must put a Clay block beneath the housing. Clay bees are the bedrock of many important bee lines. Breed them from Industrious and Diligent.

questDatabase.name: Industrious
questDatabase.description: Industrious bees produce pollen clusters, a key ingredient to the Alveary. They're also used for breeding many other bees. Their pollination speed is Fast, better than most bees. Breed them from Diligent and Unweary.

questDatabase.name: Slimeball
questDatabase.description: Slimeballs aren't super useful, but you can easily breed this bee to make them. It's a necessary step on the way to Oil though. You will need a Congealed Slime Block beneath the bee housing. Breed them from Clay and Marshy.

questDatabase.name: Stickyresin
questDatabase.description: Never having to use a treetap again?  Sign me up! You'll need to put a Rubber Wood log beneath the bee housing. Breed them from Slimeball and Peat.

questDatabase.name: Oil
questDatabase.description: Finally, Black Gold. The Oil bee, with proper...encouragement...can take care of all your power and chemical needs for quite some time. An alternate bee, Distilled, provides slightly more oil but has a longer breeding chain.  It is below the Magical bees. Breed them from Coal and Stickyresin.

questDatabase.name: Coal
questDatabase.description: Ah yes, Coal is King indeed. A great bee, giving you Coal to use to power your industry. Will require a Coal Block under your bee housing. This bee will also have the first really dangerous effect - it will apply a creeper explosion to you if you are not wearing your Apiarist suit. Breed them from Peat and Industrious.

questDatabase.name: Peat
questDatabase.description: Peat from these bees can be used in furnaces and boilers. Free fuel is free, right? Breed them from Rural and Clay.

questDatabase.name: Rural
questDatabase.description: Rural bees like to live out in the country - you'll have to relocate to a Plains-type biome for these. Breed them from Diligent and Meadows.

questDatabase.name: Blooming
questDatabase.description: A Blooming bee will bonemeal nearby saplings. This can definitely help your log and sapling production rate. They also provide the fastest pollination. Breed them from Industrious and Thriving.

questDatabase.name: Diamond
questDatabase.description: Ah finally, a girl..I mean Queen's best friend. Will require a block of Diamond. Breed from Certus and Coal.

questDatabase.name: Certus
questDatabase.description: The Certus Quartz bee. Hmm, does it have any breeding requirements? I can't see to remember. Maybe try a block of Certus Quartz? Breed it from Lapis and Hermitic.

questDatabase.name: Lapis
questDatabase.description: Finally, a bee with some real promise.  The Lapis bee will require a block of lapis to breed. Breed them from Demonic and Imperial.

questDatabase.name: Hermitic
questDatabase.description: Hermitic bees have the same no-entities requirement as Secluded, but they solve that problem themselves. They are so repugnant they repel mobs near them. Breed them from Secluded and Monastic.

questDatabase.name: Demonic
questDatabase.description: Better be careful with this one! It will set you on fire. In addition to combs, this bee can produce Glowstone Dust. It will require Nether to breed. Breed them from Sinister and Fiendish.

questDatabase.name: Sinister
questDatabase.description: Sinister bees will hurt nearby mobs and players. Make sure to wear your suit. They will require breeding in the Nether. Breed them from Modest and Cultivated.

questDatabase.name: Fiendish
questDatabase.description: Just like Sinister, Fiendish requires the Nether and a protective bee suit. Breed them from Sinister and Cultivated.

questDatabase.name: Secluded
questDatabase.description: Secluded bees are real loners. There must not be any entities within their territory for them to produce their combs. The Mellow combs can produce Nether quartz. Breed them from Monastic and Austere.

questDatabase.name: Austere
questDatabase.description: Another bee that requires an attentive beekeeper. Without an Apiarist suit, this bee will inflict creeper explosions on you. Watch you. It will require a hot or hellish biome with Arid humidity. Breed them from Modest and Frugal.

questDatabase.name: Frugal
questDatabase.description: The Frugal bee doesn't have much direct use, but is part of many breeding lines. It will require a hot or hellish biome and arid humidity. Breed them from Modest and Sinister.

questDatabase.name: Redstone Alloy
questDatabase.description: Obviously, a block of Redstone Alloy is required, right? Breed them from Red Alloy and Redstone.

questDatabase.name: Red Alloy
questDatabase.description: The Red Alloy princess will require a block of Red Alloy.  Breed them from Redstone and Copper.

questDatabase.name: Redstone
questDatabase.description: The Redstone princess will require a block of Redstone. Breed them from Industrious and Demonic.

questDatabase.name: Monastic
questDatabase.description: Monastic bees aren't found in hives or bred. Instead you will need to find a Beekeeper villager and trade with them for it. There are various ways to make more villagers, so do some research.

questDatabase.name: Vibrant Alloy
questDatabase.description: Finally.  It was a long, hazardous road, but you can now get Vibrant Alloy directly from a bee. Great job.  You'll need a Block of Vibrant Alloy. Breed them from Energetic Alloy and Phantasmal.

questDatabase.name: Energetic Alloy
questDatabase.description: Energetic Alloy will require a block of Energetic Alloy, of course. Breed them from Redstone Alloy and Demonic.

questDatabase.name: Phantasmal
questDatabase.description: Phantasmal bees are similar to Spectral, except they cause the other drops to reanimate, like ghasts, spiders, creepers, endermen, or even Ender Dragons if their drops are lying around. Breed them from Spectral and Ender.

questDatabase.name: Spectral
questDatabase.description: Spectral bees will require Ender bees to breed.  This will test the ability of even the toughest beekeeper - don't forget your apiarist suit. To work in a bee housing, there must be a Dragon Egg nearby. Don't drop any bones, blazerods or rotten meat! This bee will cause those to come back to life! Perhaps you can find a use for this ability. Breed them from Ender and Hermitic.

questDatabase.name: Fluix
questDatabase.description: If you go deep into AE2, you'll want cheap sources of Fluix from these bees. Breeding will require a block of Fluix. Breed them from Lapis and Redstone.

questDatabase.name: Ruby
questDatabase.description: For early Chrome, a Ruby bee is a great source. It will require a block of Ruby. Breed them from Redstone and Diamond.

questDatabase.name: Tin
questDatabase.description: Tin is a great early bee to get, saving your time looking for Cassiterite Sand. You'll need a Tin block. Breed them from Clay and Diligent.

questDatabase.name: Iron
questDatabase.description: Iron bees as a resource isn't that big a deal, so much stuff makes iron anyways, but they are a key breeding species. They will need an Iron block.  Breed them from Copper and Tin.

questDatabase.name: Nickel
questDatabase.description: Nickel bees provide a pretty useful resource. You'll need a block of Nickel. Breed them from Iron and Copper.

questDatabase.name: Zinc
questDatabase.description: Zinc makes great early game item pipes when mixed into brass. Also, these bees have a small change of producing Gallium combs, which is very useful for players needing to make circuits or SMD devices. These bees will require a Zinc block. Breed them from Tin and Iron.

questDatabase.name: Lead
questDatabase.description: Lead will be necessary in large quantities once you start making nuclear reactors. You'll need a block of Lead for these. Breed them from Copper and Coal.

questDatabase.name: Silver
questDatabase.description: Silver is key metal at HV and up with the amount of Electrum you will need. Requires a block of Silver. Breed them from Lead and Tin.

questDatabase.name: Aluminium
questDatabase.description: Aluminium isn't necessary until MV, but when you want it, you'll want lots. Requires block of Aluminium. Breed them from Nickel and Zinc.

questDatabase.name: Olivine
questDatabase.description: An otherwise mostly useless bee, Olivine is required for breeding better bees. I guess if you need Magnesium? Breed them from Ender and Certus.

questDatabase.name: Emerald
questDatabase.description: Ah yes, a very useful bee. Emeralds are used for many upgrades, and trading with villagers. Will require a block of Emerald. Breed them from Olivine and Diamond.

questDatabase.name: Titanium
questDatabase.description: Titanium from bees will make getting those LCRs and distillation towers a breeze.  Hey, I rhymed! You'll need a block of Titanium for this bee.  Breed them from Aluminium and Redstone.

questDatabase.name: Chrome
questDatabase.description: Chrome, a necessary ingredient for Stainless Steel. Better to get it directly instead of having to deal with Rubies or Garnets. This bee will require a block of Chrome to breed. Breed them from Titanium and Ruby.

questDatabase.name: Platinum
questDatabase.description: Platinum. Precious metal for the ages. You'll need a block of Platinum obviously. Breed them from Diamond and Chrome.

questDatabase.name: Uranium
questDatabase.description: All that hatred had a purpose - to create this bee, capable of producing enormous power. As before, keep away from everything.  This bee will require a block of Uranium. Breed them from Avenging and Platinum.

questDatabase.name: Plutonium
questDatabase.description: A metal that represents the epitome of technology. Never existing in the universe before man. Destroying everything around it. This bee will require a block of Plutonium. Breed them from Uranium and Emerald.

questDatabase.name: Avenging
questDatabase.description: Hatred distilled into its most violent form. Keep away from everything. Breed them from Vengeful and Vindictive.

questDatabase.name: Vengeful
questDatabase.description: Hatred. Of all things, living and solid. Keep bee housing away from anything valuable, or even not valuable. Breed them from Monastic and Vindictive.

questDatabase.name: Vindictive
questDatabase.description: Beware. These bees not only hate everything, they even hate blocks. Put their bee housing far away from everything. Breed them from Demonic and Monastic.

questDatabase.name: Moron's Guide to Breeding Better Bees
questDatabase.description:
First off, don't be scared by the massive amounts of bees you see here once you unlock the breeding trees. There's even more that aren't included and you'll need NEI to find!

Ha ha, just kidding - don't panic! Once you unlock the bee breeding lines, look around and pick and choose which bees really interest you. The way the breeding is done is mostly left to right, and top down. Some of the lines at the bottom might look simple, but they will require bees further up to complete first. Many of the basic bees have multiple breeding options, only one is shown here.

Bees have two sets of traits, one active that has effects on how the bee lives, and one Inactive but can be used for breeding. When getting newly bred princesses and drones, check both sets in case you got the target bee. You can breed the bees with inactive traits to try and make them active in later crosses. You can't see the passive traits using a Field Kit, you'll need a Beealyzer. For lots of bees, you can scan them first using a GT scanner, but you'll still need a Beealyzer to see passive traits.

When breeding bees, a good idea is to settle upon a master template bee.  A bee that has little or no crossbreeding potential, but has all the traits you prefer - short life, nocturnal, cavedwelling, rain tolerant, humidity, temperature, high fertility, etc.  Once you have that bee, breed a bunch of pure princesses with those traits as both active and inactive. These will be your breeding stock.

When you are trying for a new bee, what you are wanting is a drone - this way you can use your "breeding stock" princess for easy breeding, but the drone to get the new species without the annoying effects or limitations. Poor crossed princesses can be returned to normal by crossing with breeding stock drones, or just thrown out if they now have annoying restrictions. Make sure you keep the trait and species you want, and slowly merge the good traits from your breeding stock. You don't have to do this part in an Apiary, you can use a Bee House to swap around traits. Ignoble bees are good for this, since they're mostly disposable - they have a chance to die after 100 breeding cycles - frames can let them live longer. Once you solidify your species, create a pool of drones. You can use those to convert pristine princesses to the new species. Pristine princesses will not die. Rocky bees are a great source - all their princesses are always pristine.

Once you get a new species, it will replace all of one of the two sets of traits of the bee.  For example when you get a Cultivated, either the Active or Inactive column will have all the default Cultivated traits. Mix it a few times and you'll eventually get purebred versions. Just watch out that you don't lose a key trait, like Fast Worker for Cultivated! All the quests will require purebred species. 

Generally all traits can be bred into any bee species, including effects or flower preference. Species generally require their preferred biome to produce their special drops.

Advanced frames can provide useful boosts to mutation chances, or to lifespan reduction for faster breeding cycles. However excessive multipliers will increase genetic decay, giving a chance for that pristine princess to become ignoble!

It looks complex, because it is! But it also a lot of dangerous and useful fun!

questDatabase.name: Dealing with Radiation
questDatabase.description:
Nuclear materials cause two types of radiation effects. One is a large number of standard debuffs. These can be removed the normal ways, with milk or terra wart or other methods that imitate them. 

The other effect is a special Radiation  unique debuff.  This gets applied the longer you hold onto the radioactive item. Severely radioactive items can apply minutes of this deadly debuff. Regeneration might delay the inevitable death, but most regneration sources aren't fast enough or long enough to keep you alive. You can try using an Amulet of Remedium to get rid of the effects. You should have one from your Moon trip, if not you'll have to dive into Thaumcraft to make one.

questDatabase.name: Basic Bee Stats
questDatabase.description:
There are a couple of basic bees that have good stats you will want to breed into your breeding stock.

Cave Dwelling - Rocky - This lets you put the bee housing underneath or inside. Handy for putting a chest on top for products.

Nocturnal - Rocky - This keeps your bees working all night long, and in the dark.

Rain Tolerant - Water - Keep producing even when it is raining.

High Fertility - Wintry - For breeding purposes, you want the maximum number of drones produced.

questDatabase.name: Arcane
questDatabase.description: Enchanting drops from Arcane bees are used to create Aromatic Lumps for use in the Swarmer. It has a higher chance of success than normal Royal Jelly. These bees are the other bedrock of the Magic Bees branch. Breed them from Esoteric and Mysterious.

questDatabase.name: Eldritch
questDatabase.description: Eldritch are the start of the magic bee family. Breed them from Mystical and Cultivated.

questDatabase.name: Supernatural
questDatabase.description: What have those two brothers gotten into now? The Supernatural bee is a keystone of the Magical branch of bees. Check NEI for details on the best lunar phase for breeding. Breed it from Charmed and Enchanted.

questDatabase.name: Enchanted
questDatabase.description: Enchanted is the next step in the progression. Breed them from Charmed and Eldritch.

questDatabase.name: Charmed
questDatabase.description: The power of three!  Charmed bees are your next step up the magic bee tree. Breed them from Eldritch and Cultivated.

questDatabase.name: Mysterious
questDatabase.description: Just your mysterious stranger... Breed them from Eldritch and Esoteric.

questDatabase.name: Esoteric
questDatabase.description: Another basic Magic branch bee. Breed them from Eldritch and Cultivated.

questDatabase.name: Ethereal
questDatabase.description: Ethereal bees are critical for all the magical aspect bees. Breed them from Arcane and Supernatural.

questDatabase.name: Aqua
questDatabase.description: Aqua requires a Water Crystal Cluster. It will produce Water infused dust. Staying nearby will clear potion effects, like drinking a bucket of milk. Might be useful for the clever industrial engineer! Breed them from two Watery.

questDatabase.name: Firey
questDatabase.description: Firey bees must be bred on top of Lava. Breed them from Ethereal and Supernatural.

questDatabase.name: Earthen
questDatabase.description: Earthen bees must be bred on top of Bricks. Breed them from Supernatural and Ethereal.

questDatabase.name: Windy
questDatabase.description: Windy bees must be bred on top of Oak leaves. Breed them using Ethereal and Supernatural.

questDatabase.name: Aer
questDatabase.description: For Aer bees to appear, you must put an Air Crystal Cluster beneath the bee housing. They will produce Aer infused dust for you. Being nearby will grant a Swiftness buff. Breed them from two Windy.

questDatabase.name: Solum
questDatabase.description: Solum bees require Earth Crystal Clusters. They can produce Earth infused dust. It will also give you a mining speed boost. Breed them from two Earthen.

questDatabase.name: Ignis
questDatabase.description: Ignis bees require Fire Crystal Clusters beneath the bee housing. They will produce Fire infused dust. Watch out! They will set nearby entities on fire! Breed them from two Firey.

questDatabase.name: Watery
questDatabase.description: Watery bees must be bred over Water. Breed them from Ethereal and Supernatural.

questDatabase.name: Aware
questDatabase.description: Not much to say about this bee.  Breed them from Ethereal and Attuned.

questDatabase.name: Spirit
questDatabase.description: The Spirit bee is the first bee to give you Soul Combs, necessary for Soulful Wax, used in many magical frames. Breed them from Ethereal and Aware.

questDatabase.name: Soul
questDatabase.description: The Soul bee has the highest chance of making Soul Combs, 20 percent. Breed them from Aware and Spirit.

questDatabase.name: Chaotic
questDatabase.description: Chaotic bees require an Entropic Crystal Cluster. They will produce Entropy Infused Dust. Breed them from Ethereal and Supernatural.

questDatabase.name: Ordered
questDatabase.description: Ordered bees require Ordered Crystal Clusters. They can produce Order Infused Dust. Breed them from Arcane and Ethereal.

questDatabase.name: Vis
questDatabase.description: Vis bees lead to some of the most powerful bees in the whole pack. They require a node within 75m of the bee housing. Make sure the lunar phase matches the requirments. Breed them from Ethereal and Eldritch.

questDatabase.name: Rejuvenating
questDatabase.description: Rejuvenating bees must be bred within 25m of a node.  They will slowly charge the nearest node. Breed them from Vis and Attuned.

questDatabase.name: Empowering
questDatabase.description: The Empowering bee will randomly add aspects to nearby nodes, allowing enormous power to build up. The best chance to breed them is during the Full moon. Breed them from Rejuvenating and Vis.

questDatabase.name: Edenic
questDatabase.description: The Edenic bee has the remarkable effect of giving experience points to players nearby. Breed it from Exotic and Tropical.

questDatabase.name: Exotic
questDatabase.description: Watch out, just like its parent the Exotic bee will poison you. But it is also a source of silk wisps. Breed them from Austere and Tropical.

questDatabase.name: Thaumium Dust
questDatabase.description: Thaumium is pretty easy to make, but with this bee you can automate and get enormous quantities. It requires a block of Thaumium. Breed them from Edenic and Ignis.

questDatabase.name: Skulking
questDatabase.description: Skulking bees are the core of the various mob bees. Check out the rest of the recipes in NEI, there are too many to show here. Breed them using Eldritch and Modest.

questDatabase.name: Spidery
questDatabase.description: Watch out, the effect from this bee will attract spiders. But it has one nice trait - a large working area. Perfect for breeding into your fast pollinators or for providing useful effects. Breed it from Skulking and Tropical.

questDatabase.name: Thaumic Shards
questDatabase.description: The Thaumic Shards bee has a chance of giving you any shard propolis. It will require a Magical Forest biome. Breed them from Thaumium Dust and Aqua.

questDatabase.name: Salis Mundus
questDatabase.description: Tired of all the effort it takes to make Salis Mundus? After hours of breeding you can now do magic trouble free with this bee making all the Salis Mundus you need. It requires a Magical Forest Biome. Breed them from Thaumic Shards and Thaumium Dust.

questDatabase.name: Heroic
questDatabase.description: This one takes a little luck. You'll have to find Steadfast bees in a dungeon chest. Their useful effect is causing damage to hostile mobs. Breed them from Steadfast and Valiant.

questDatabase.name: Nameless
questDatabase.description: Oblivion bees can be purchased with coins, or found in the End. Nameless is required to get Draconic bees. Nameless are also where you can get Amnesiac Wax. Breed them from Oblivion and Ethereal.

questDatabase.name: Abandoned
questDatabase.description: Abandoned are the next step up. Breed them from Oblivion and Nameless.

questDatabase.name: Draconic
questDatabase.description: The Draconic bee is required in order to get the dusts needed to recreate the Dragon Egg using magic. It must be bred in the End. Breed them from Imperial and Abandoned.

questDatabase.name: Wither
questDatabase.description: The Wither bee will let you generate Wither skulls and small amounts of Nether star dust. It requires a block of Nether Star, and must be bred in the End. Breed them from Withering and Draconic.

questDatabase.name: Withering
questDatabase.description: Inflicts Withering all those who come near. Must be bred in the Nether. Chances are going to be low, so now would be the time to look for frames that increase mutation rates. Breed them from Demonic and Spiteful.

questDatabase.name: Spiteful
questDatabase.description: The sheer disdain this bee shows you is awe inspiring. Must be bred in the Nether. Don't walk around it without proper protection, it seems to laugh when you think about that. Breed them from Hateful and Infernal.

questDatabase.name: Hateful
questDatabase.description: You can feel the waves of hate radiating out of her eyes. Don't even think about getting close without an Apiarist Suit. Must be bred in the Nether. Breed them from Eldritch and Infernal.

questDatabase.name: Excited
questDatabase.description: You might be thinking to yourself, huh this sure is an easy bee to give redstone....well, it also gives destructive lightning strikes. You might want to place them far from you. Or set them up in a Creeper spawner to make charged creepers for...experiments. Breed them from Valiant and Cultivated.

questDatabase.name: Celebratory
questDatabase.description: This fun bee doesn't have any useful products, but it does produce a fun effect - constant fireworks! You can breed the effect into other lines, and the color of the fireworks will match the bee. Make the bees require sky and you can disable the effects by covering them up with a piston. Great for a celebration! Breed them from Austere and Excited.

questDatabase.name: Too much Mercury?
questDatabase.description: After a couple of hours..days..weeks..of processing redstone for Ruby you'll have a massive stockpile of Mercury and not know what to do with it.  You can store it all in supertanks, but really, how much hypochlorous acid does one need? Instead you can build an Acid Generator and at least get a little power out of it.

questDatabase.name: Arsenic Princess
questDatabase.description: This deadly little princess will get you Arsenic, perfect for use in your circuits. Requires a Block of Arsenic. Breed them from Silver and Zinc.

questDatabase.name: Keep calm and bee on
questDatabase.description: The gentle frame can help protect your bees from the damaging effects of high productivity or mutation rates.

questDatabase.name: Brazil Nut
questDatabase.description: Brazil Nuts don't give you much in the way of important attributes. Breed them from Common Beech and Jungle.

questDatabase.name: Coconut
questDatabase.description: Coconut is King for seedoil production - 300L per nut. Breed them from Brazil Nut and Balsa.

questDatabase.name: Aromatic Lump
questDatabase.description: Aromatic Lumps are twice as effective as Royal Jelly in an Alveary Swarmer. You'll need Enchanting Drops from Arcane bees and Pollen Clusters from Industrious bees.

questDatabase.name: Infinite bats! Wait, what??
questDatabase.description:
Tired of the constant chirping from the thousands of bats drawn to your world-bending activities? Use this handy device to attract them to a central location where they can be...disposed. The Corporeal Attractor can be configured to attract or repel mobs, and the redstone strength applied divided by two determines the range.

You can use Soul Moulds to filter the mobs the Attractor draws in or pushes away. This gives you some idea for automating...

questDatabase.name: Better boots with a little pizzazz
questDatabase.description: These Electric Boots of the Traveller will give a 2 percent vis discount along with the benefits of the normal Boots.

questDatabase.name: Walk all over you
questDatabase.description: Nanosuit boots will give the nanosuit benefits along with a massive speed boost, higher jump, and better vis discount. Great boots for the master magical engineer.

questDatabase.name: Walking across the stars
questDatabase.description: Quantum boots of the traveller, for when you really need to run as fast as the wind. Might cause you some problems standing still!

questDatabase.name: Industrial Grafter
questDatabase.description: If you're tired of constantly replacing branchcutters, this Industrial Grafter is rechargeable.

questDatabase.name: Do you taste metal?
questDatabase.description: Metal oreberries are a great source of new seeds. You can breed some or buy some from the Coins shop. I need some Copper myself, so give me some berries please.

questDatabase.name: Deep blue sea of sapphires
questDatabase.description: Sapphirum are pretty easy to get from Copper Oreberries.  You'll need a block of Sapphire beneath them to get them to maturity. They are a good source of aluminium and oxygen in LV.

questDatabase.name: Red touch yellow
questDatabase.description: Garnets are actually more valuable than Sapphires. They're an early source of Chrome and Manganese, which you'll need for HV machines. To reach maturity, you will need a block of Garnet beneath these crops. You can get Garnets from the HV macerator and Spessartine Ore, or you can use an Implosion Compressor to turn Garnet Sands into crystals to make blocks.

questDatabase.name: A travel companion
questDatabase.description:
Lonely? The Traveling Trunk is a simple companion, giving you some extra space. With upgrades (one per trunk) it can offer you some nice advantages. Like other golems, you can pick it up with the Golemancer's Bell. It's brain is pretty small though, so it can easily get stuck. You can order it to stay in one spot via the GUI. It will attempt to teleport to you, as long as the chunk is still loaded. It can also follow you into different dimensions.

They will heal slowly on their own, or faster if you right-click on them with any food, including rotten meat. Keep away from lava.

Golem upgrade effects:
Aer: Moves faster
Earth: 1 more row of item slots
Fire: Attacks hostile mobs, setting them on fire
Water: Nearly invulnerable. In SMP, can only be opened or picked up by player who placed it.
Entropy: Sucks in loose items nearby if it has room
Order: Can be picked up with its contents, and nested in other inventories. Don't be stupid.

questDatabase.name: Who needs friends?
questDatabase.description: Luggage is better than a dumb old traveling trunk.  It automatically picks up dropped items, saving you time while mining. It's near-invulnerable, including in lava. It will follow you like an eager puppy, to the ends of the earth - but you probably should pick her up before changing dimensions. A lightning strike can provide more room. Shift right-clicking will turn it back into an item without losing its contents. Look for her in the GTNH tab of the Thaumonomicon

questDatabase.name: Magenta
questDatabase.description: Magenta bees are also Fastest production, but come with +- 3 Climate. Breed them from Pink and Blue.

questDatabase.name: Pink
questDatabase.description: Pink princesses provide pink dye. They also have Fastest production and +-3 Humidity. Breed them from Red and White.

questDatabase.name: White
questDatabase.description: White bees provide white dye. Breed them from Forest and Diligent.

questDatabase.name: Red
questDatabase.description: Dye bees obviously provide dyes, but some of them are also useful for their traits. There are many dye bees, these are just a sample. They can be useful for the hard to find dye colors from flowers. Breed Red from Common and Diligent.

questDatabase.name: Blue
questDatabase.description: Blue princesses will provide  a handy source of blue dye. Breed them from Forest and Diligent.

questDatabase.name: Batty
questDatabase.description: Batty bees will spawn firebats. So prepare for battle. Their specialty is Gunpowder. Breed them from Skulking and Windy.

questDatabase.name: Ghastly
questDatabase.description: Ghastly bees will spawn Ghasts, so beeee careful. Their specialty is Ghast Tears. They only have 1 fertility so you want to make sure you breed the drones with your master template princess. Breed them from Batty and Ethereal.

questDatabase.name: Smouldering
questDatabase.description: Smouldering drones will spawn blazes, and make Blaze Rods as their specialty. Breed the drones with your template princesses so you can prevent the harmful effects from destroying your base. Also, their Hellish temperature and Normal humidity requirements are interesting - use a Climate Acclimator or other methods to adjust the biome. Must be bred in the Nether. Breed them from Ghastly and Hateful.

questDatabase.name: Refined
questDatabase.description: Ah, here it is. This bee has been known to power whole civilizations. Placed in a top tier bee housing like an Alveary or Industrial Apiary, with appropriate frames, it can produce oil faster than some wells. In addition, you will get small amounts of Diesel fuel as well! Breed them from Oily and Distilled.

questDatabase.name: Distilled
questDatabase.description: What's this?  A step back you say! Yes, the Distilled bee doesn't make anything of use, but the potential is there. Breed them from Oily and Industrious.

questDatabase.name: Oily
questDatabase.description: Finally, the Oily bee! Its combs produce the most oil, but its output isn't that thrilling...yet.  Breed them from Primeval and Ocean. As an alternative, you can breed them from Primeval and Frugal if you can't find an Ocean biome or used up all your Beekeeper coins.

questDatabase.name: Primeval
questDatabase.description: Primeval. The next step. Breed them from Ancient and Secluded.

questDatabase.name: Ancient
questDatabase.description: Ancient bees are the first step to the best oil bees in the game. Breed them from Diligent and Noble.

questDatabase.name: Ocean
questDatabase.description: The Ocean bee can be hard to breed since some servers use a worldgen that prevents ocean biomes from appearing. You might have luck trying in a Twilight Forest lake - you'll know you are in the right biome if you see Water Creepers! If you have trouble locating an appropriate spot, you can also purchase Ocean bees from the Coins tab. Breed them from Diligent and Water.

questDatabase.name: Resinous
questDatabase.description: Well at least you can get a couple of Sticky Resin from this otherwise boring bee. Breed them from Miry and Primeval.

questDatabase.name: Miry
questDatabase.description: Miry bees aren't too useful yet. They'll open up the Boggy branch for you.  You'll need to find a biome with Warm/Damp to breed them. Use your Nature's Compass and Habitat Locator to find them. An easy one to find is Rainforest. Breed them from Marshy and Noble.

questDatabase.name: Elastic
questDatabase.description: Finally!  A useful bee from the Boggy branch. The Elastic bee will actually produce rubber bars for you!  No more smelly Sulfur!  Breed them from Distilled and Resinous.

questDatabase.name: Master registry
questDatabase.description: The master beekeeper needs a master registry. Make sure you don't get any tears in your apiaries as you collect all the requirements!

questDatabase.name: Agrarian
questDatabase.description: Agrarian bees are supposed to help crops nearby grow. The effect isn't really that noticeable, is it? You'll have to be in a Plains-like biome for these to appear. Breed them from Farmerly and Industrious.

questDatabase.name: Farmerly
questDatabase.description: Like most farmers, these bees seem to spend all their time complaining about the neighbors or the weather instead of actually doing much. They'll need a Plains-like biome.  Breed them from Unweary and Rural.

questDatabase.name: Sandwich
questDatabase.description: sudo make me a sandwich.  Or a bee that makes sandwich parts anyways. Breed them from Batty and Agrarian.

questDatabase.name: Fertilizer
questDatabase.description: The Fertilizer bee will make your crop empire purr.  Or grow anyways. They are a good source of Fastest production and Faster pollination as well. Breed them from Apatite and Ash.

questDatabase.name: Apatite
questDatabase.description: The Apatite bee requires an Apatite Block beneath it to breed. Its Seedy comb will make seedoil as well. Breed them from Ash and Coal.

questDatabase.name: Ash
questDatabase.description: A bee to make ashes?  What insanity is this?  At least you can get Large territory from them. You'll need to pay the Nether a visit. Breed them from Clay and Coal.

questLines.name: Tier 0 - It begins
questLines.description: The very first tier, tier zero. This chapter will introduce you to the basic mechanics of this modpack. Mods covered: Vanilla, Pam's Harvestcraft.

questLines.name: Tier 0.5 - Stone Age
questLines.description: Basically the "Tier 0" of all your progression. This set helps you through the first tier until you can build your first steam machine

questLines.name: Tier 1 - Steam
questLines.description: Quest set for all steam-based machines.

questLines.name: Tier 2 - 32 EU (LV)
questLines.description:
The first "voltage" tier of this pack. Things are getting easier...
BTW, if you can't see any quests, click in the quest window or use the mousewheel to zoom in and out.

questLines.name: Tier 3 - 128 EU (MV)
questLines.description:
Your second voltage tier. Don't mix different voltage levels, or you will be punished in a hard way. Start thinking about how to expand your base. 
Again, use mousewheel to zoom out to see quests.

questLines.name: Tier 4 - 512 EU (HV)
questLines.description: Finally some power to work with. This tier will help you reach distant planets and gather more rare resources to build even more advanced machines.

questLines.name: Tier 5 - 2048 EU (EV)
questLines.description: Titanium level, fissile energy sources, Applied Energistics 2.

questLines.name: Tier 6 - 8192 EU (IV)
questLines.description: Tungsten level, Asteriod dims, assembly line

questLines.name: Tier 7 - 32768 EU (LuV)
questLines.description: If you have made it this far, you should walk with your head held high - you are at the start of the lategame. Endgame is still a long road ahead of you, but you are now an expert at GTNH and most of the mods it comes with. Congrats, and be proud of your Big Dick Energy.

questLines.name: Fusion
questLines.description: Making power for the lategame tiers, LuV-UMV

questLines.name: Fishing Farming Cooking
questLines.description: Catch it, grow it, eat it!

questLines.name: Armors and Jetpacks
questLines.description: Guiding you through the armor and jetpacks and Adventure Backpacks.

questLines.name: Multiblock Goals
questLines.description: This set is a global tracker for multiblock structure goals. As you can build several parts of many multiblocks way earlier than the respective tier. Check back often.

questLines.name: Building Better Bases
questLines.description: Tired of torches everywhere making your base look like a loser built it? Make your base look like a winner with these quests. (under construction)

questLines.name: Steve Carts
questLines.description: Basic auto farming and mining.  Protect them from lightning strikes!

questLines.name: Project Red
questLines.description: Low tier storage and automation. You'll need a forming press to get started.

questLines.name: Coins, Coins, Coins
questLines.description:
These quests will guide you to use your Coins wisely and buy some useful or fancy stuff.
Zoom out using mousewheel to see all the amazing things for sale!

questLines.name: GT++
questLines.description: GT++ adds new functionality to GT, including high speed multiblocks - Under Construction

questLines.name: Forestry and Multi-farms
questLines.description: Automated Farms, tree breeding, and more.....

questLines.name: Be(e) Breeding
questLines.description: Breeding Bees for Better Bling (experimental, may cause honey leakage)

questLines.name: How to be(e)
questLines.description: A non-tiered quest set that is meant as an in game, quest based tutorial and guide to bees. Since they are a really helpful tool to advance forward.

questLines.name: Slice and splice
questLines.description: An introduction to using Binnie's Genetics mod for bees, trees, and Botany flowers. (under construction)

questLines.name: Novice Thaumaturge
questLines.description: Magic lies beyond. Great achievements, but also a lot of work. I shall be your guide. Follow my instructions, and you shall become a great wizard, like me.

questLines.name: Adept Thaumaturgy
questLines.description: Warp included.

questLines.name: Kaaami, Haaaami, ... HA!
questLines.description: Ultimate (magical) POWER!!!

questLines.name: Focus on Wand Foci
questLines.description: Did you know which wand focus is useful and which not?

questLines.name: Electro Magic
questLines.description: This Tab focus on Electro Magic Tools and Thaumic Energistics. These are some nice mods, that will help you with machinery and magic.

questLines.name: Look to the edges
questLines.description: Granny Weatherwax would approve.

questLines.name: Paying the highest price
questLines.description: When regular magic just won't cover it, pay demons to do it for you! The cost might scare some people... But no risk no fun!

questLines.name: More blood, more stuff
questLines.description: Advanced Blood Magic? My veins feel weird...

questLines.name: They are coming...
questLines.description: The spirits that I've called... Demon invasions and beyond. Really deep into dark magic!

questLines.name: Open Computers
questLines.description: The magical world of ingame programming!

questLines.name: Stacy's Factory Manager
questLines.description: Right? Right.

questLines.name: Transportation
questLines.description: From four legged steeds to iron horses

questLines.name: Space Race
questLines.description: A guide to help you start Galacticraft and reach the Moon

questLines.name: Applied Energistics
questLines.description: AE2 focuses on creating a compact, easily accessible, considerably extendible storage system called an ME Network.

questLines.name: An Age of Tech
questLines.description: I've been keeping a watchful eye on your technological advance - it's time to see the dreams of a technological future! I shall guide you to a whole new complicated series of machinery. Be wary though, these machines will test your resolve (and energy limits) to the extreme. (under construction)

questLines.name: Kill all the things
questLines.description: This world is full of nasty things. Time to kill some and improve your reputation.

questLines.name: To grind, or not to grind
questLines.description: That is the question. Do you want good tools? Well, then go grind stuff! The rewards of these quests are worth it, trust me.

questLines.name: Legendary Quests
questLines.description: A legendary quest-line with difficult tasks, expensive recipes and potentially dangerous locations. Are you prepared?

questLines.name: Legendary Tier X
questLines.description: A legendary quest-line with difficult tasks, expensive recipes and potentially dangerous locations. Are you prepared?

questLines.name: Legendary Infinity
questLines.description: A legendary questline with difficult tasks, expensive recipes and potentially dangerous locations. Are you prepared?

questLines.name: Reward Area
questLines.description: Upgrade your loot bags!
